🌷 3109. ashxstry asked:
this is such an amazing story, miss. i love the colour metaphors even though some really confuses me lmao. and the parallels between the past and future got me screaming (internally, the barista didnt need another worry). evergreen, which i usually see in a more fluffy? setting and this story does that too but i love that it refers to a moodtracker of all thing XD and not lose it meaning too so i think its really a clever use ;A;

you know maybe one day i’ll read this again and then i might relate more to their growth, maybe? instead of jisoo’s struggle, which admittedly, hit too close to home. been doing some self deprecation myself these days and probably not the best time to review this because welp, more trauma dumping in your cc ;A;

i guess when you’re struggling with self esteem, some part of you just believe that you’re unlovable, and you believe its hard for people to love you (and it probably is hard to some extent ?) so it will just hurt both sides. soo yep, need to work on that.

i really love the idea that growth is not feeling happy all the time, but letting yourself be human and feel what you feel. it recently has been on my mind, that i feel envious when i see people be vulnerable, honest with their emotions. but its also scary, because its… vulnerable, you know? like its easy to get hurt.

also, special mention to the crack on seungcheol’s wall that might or might not be an imagery of something broken in jisoo/seungcheol or in their relationship that seungcheol tried to cover clumsily with correction tapes. i might be reading on it too deeply, but i like the crack, so i will put my own meaning to it.

thank you, miss, for writing this :) there are so many lines that spoke to my heart, and i’ll probably remember it from time to time. thank you so much, i love youuuu
Author's reply: aaa thank you so much for dropping by, muse :') always love these discussions with you.

hope you're faring well in uni though :') don't forget to take care of yourself!! i don't mind the trauma dumping wjshsg i've been there, and i'm here to give my two cents if you need them (you don't need to follow them though LOL). i read somewhere recently that shared joy is a double joy, and shared sorrow is half the sorrow :) i hope u get to see a handful of green days :) :) and i hope your sage greens are eclipsed with patience and love and joy from your tribe <3

getting comfortable with being vulnerable takes time :) don't rush, and give yourself the grace you would give everyone else. i'm rooting for u!! love you too :) xx

🌷 3108. ashxstry asked:

“Mostly, yes.” Jisoo had no reason to lie.

they are fine. they grown and theyre fine now :((

“Jisoo wore feelings on his sleeves now. In their time apart, he’s learned how to be burdened with a human heart that felt too deeply.”

thats so nice :((

“It was enough proof for me that I could find happiness so deep it made me feel afraid.”

oh, was this what he meant when he said he’s scared of jisoo ;A;

“He knitted an emerald sweater with a red lion for Cheol, and Rudolph with a bright red nose on his sage green sweater.”

RED AND GREEN. RED AND GREEN. HE SAID IT WAS UGLY THATS WHAT I THOUGHT THE COMBINATION CAN BE PRETTY, LIKE CHRISTMAS

“appreciation filling his words, holding it close to his chest. “I’ve never received something so thoughtful.””

okayyyy get appreciation away from me i cannot handle it ;A; (i crave it so much it hurts)

The oldest was a book purchased the same year he signed under his publisher.

“But never red. Never teal. Always the top threshold.”

oh wait so teal is not really green so again, why do you use teal at the start? what does it meannn? oh wait, does it mean random days? not really good or bad, just another random days that they stick with you?

Forever was a moment. criesss tearsss

thank you for the patience eclipsing my sage greens.

sage greens. is it like, soft happy days? so does patience eclipsing sage greens mean the patience exceeds the soft happiness? thank you for the patience that covers my sage greens? sorry im trying my best to understand but eclipsing confuses me ahdhajhfja but im guessing its somewhere along ‘thank you for your patience that made it possible for me to have sage green days’?

THIS LINE IS SO SWEET I’D CRY seungcheol was so patient he deserves all appreciation :(( and every person that loves regardless extreme bad days and good days, and in between, appreciation to them and their patience :(

cont.
Author's reply: re: sage greens. it may depend on the person but if you look up the shade, it's a muted green colour, less saturation and lower contrast. i associate it with spring :) the season after harsh winters, and a desolation of life. a new beginning, per se. or a promise of happiness, yet not quite there. or perhaps just being content with the present, a quiet buzz of calm and comfort.

so yes, it can be soft happy days :) when i said i thank people for the patience eclipsing my sage greens, it means i'm grateful for the patience everyone has as i overcome my winters and transition to fresh beginnings, which can be quite unsteady as there's a susceptibility to regress. sage greens for me is unstable territory, but a lot of kind souls have and had always helped me through it, eclipsing the instability of it :)
September 19, 2024 08:47 AM

“I disagree,” Seungcheol copied his tone, “I like talking to you. Everything you say is interesting. I could talk with you all day and be content,” :(( thats sweet

oh it must be frustrating to be in love with someone who cannot accept that they are loved :((

Jisoo looked pointedly at the crack in the wall, unskillfully hidden under white tape,

“I will never be sorry for loving you.” STOP STOP IM SAD

‘You fell in love with the easier parts of me.’ was how he ended it.

“Jisoo asked dumbly and Seungcheol just smiled, looking at him with such fascination, an uncontained amusement.”

sigh i dont know there is such a heavy acceptance here that i cant even begin to describe but it heals a part of me :( its like ‘ah you’re still you, still cant imagine that i care about you, you little cutie’

“Oh,” the corners of Seungcheol’s lips turned downwards.

POOR GUY must’ve thought he got rejected again

cont.
Author's reply: the crack on the wall represents cheol's own mental health problems :) it's covered with liquid correction, but it's still there, noticeable.

"oh it must be frustrating to be in love with someone who cannot accept that they are loved" combine that with your own insecurities and unresolved issues and you got a recipe for young adult angst and disaster! xD

"why would anyone see the worst of someone and stay" that's how most relationships work out, though! :) it's choosing to be with your person through their best and their worst. it's choosing what battles you can fight for the ones you love without losing your own.

and cheol did know jisoo was fighting his own battles :) he knew jisoo wasn't in his best state, yet he chose to stay.

idk if i said this before,, but cheol and jisoo share hana as a therapist. that's a huge part of the plot i was only hinting on. the reason why cheol also bumps into him after his therapy sessions and the reason he said "i'm free in an hour" before their first hangout.

cheol is actually the therapy schedule after jisoo's. that's why hana started connecting the dots that her clients have crushes on each other lol ;A; she can't do much due to patient confidentially though.

“Having so many eyes on you, isn’t that scary? I could barely function on my expectations, but to have thousands of external pressure on you? That’s horrifying.” SO REAL. it baffles me. and i always think those kind of positions are for people who has visions- things they want to do and change.

Seungcheol explained with a nervous tilt, “it’s nice to get to know other people,”

“Oh,” Seungcheol, Jisoo noticed, had very animated expressions.

Seungcheol pursed his lips, his cheeks puffing up from his uncontained smile.

YOUR HONOUR I HAVE EVIDENCES

Seungcheollie Psych bestie <3

aw i love these kind of people :(( just barge in your life and take their seat unapologetically.

He switched to another application, stared at his moodtracker for a while, and decided his day hadn’t ended yet.

“You’ve had inconsistent entries for the past week,”

WHY IS THIS SO REAL HAHA thats the problem with moodtracker its really hard to be consistenttt and sometimes i had to think really hard if the day what mood to put in because… a day is really long ? i can start it in a good mood but end it in a bad mood so yeah its a struggle

He knew what it meant. It meant he was content enough not to open the mood-tracking app because perhaps he hadn’t felt anything extreme in a while.

ok i cried a little. good for you, good for you.

“Will everyone forget him? A passing acquaintance in their social sphere? He wasn’t as brilliant as Seungcheol, nor as cheerful as Seokmin, or as playful as Jeonghan. He was just unremarkable and he should have been content with that fact.”

CRIED A LOT i read this 9am at an empty cafe i hope the barista wasnt too concerned. i hate this feeling so much :(( when the event ends and we no longer have business to discuss, no more weekly meetings, no reasons to meet each other, and the connections just,, die down. its just hard to reach out, especially when everyone’s busy with their own life :(

“Do I have to lie to you?” Jisoo chuckled without humour, knowing how much ‘I’m okay, I’m great, I’m fine,’ left his mouth mindlessly to appease the other person.

September 19, 2024 08:12 AM
🌷 3105. ashxstry asked:
*inhale* EVERGREEN YAP SESSION! 9 months late but here i am!!!

“to my friends, whose love transcends my scarlets and teals.”

WHAT DO YOU MEAN SCARLET AND TEAL WHAT WHY- was my reaction before i read it and then it makes sense ITS SO SWEET PLEASE

not doing things half full, welp you didnt have to call me out like that especially “Write ten thousand words a day. Stop writing for ten months.” WHY IS THAT SO TRUE

“He still went after things, still functional on the outside, still achieved what was expected—even at the expense of losing a few parts along the way.”

one time i went to my counsellor, talked to them about my problems with friends and family. they told me: “but you still have good grades and get things done. you still strive even without them.” as if… other things dont matter as long as im successful. and what was i supposed to do with that ;A; sometimes i feel like some people cannot grasp that high functioning people can be sad too. sometimes i feel like im faking it because there’s nothing wrong on the outside.

“you should slow down a bit.”

thats funny because i got the exact opposite advice ;A; “you should try joining clubs and find some hobbies.” as if i dont already have millions of that. to be fair, my minds dont really cooperate when i have too much free times, it will create more problems instead tehee

“I have an assignment for you, Jisoo.”

uu i love therapy assignments XD am familiar with moodtracker, and now “scarlets and teals” make sense!!! aww. :(( which raise one question from me: why teal? i get scarlet, its like red red, angry red, horrible intensely bad day red. teal though, i had to search how teal looks like (idrk colours XD) is it green? is it blue? do you have any reason you choose teal, or is it just a shade of green?

“Bumped into someone today. Jisoo wrote.”

reminded me of something i read somewhere: sometimes we’re one person away from having our life changed. of course its not as dramatic as someone saving us from everything. but people, you know, define lots of moments in our life, and you’d think im glad i met them even for a short while. it… kind of gives me hope that life wont be red forever.

“You have to be comfortable with the idea of being imperfect,”

*laugh nervously in fear of abandonment

seriously, i heard this one. the whole ‘you push yourself to be good at everything because you think having flaw will make people hate you’ thingy, so my struggles are a bit different. but ive met people who cannot start what they want to do because not being good at it scares them, so… that must be hard :((

“Not really something worth noting,” “But something worth mentioning,” REAL

cont.
Author's reply: [evergreen spoilers]

hi muse :') i've missed you!

re: your counsellor. i experienced the same thing the first time i talked to a psychologist, and i'm really sorry you had to go through being told those things :( just because people stand on privilege doesn't mean they're not allowed to feel helplessness.

sometimes (a lot of times), it's still difficult to find someone who would understand us completely, even with people who were meant to help us. the most important thing is you don't blame yourself for having to feel these things, and we have to realise that even with professionals, it's not a one size fits all. we just have to find the right counsellor/psych/therapist for us :)

i completely agree with what you said regarding high functioning people. what you need is to sit down with your emotions, acknowledge them, be comfortable with them, and [slow down]. pursuing more could lead to burnout :( my friends and i never had any good experiences with college counsellors, too. i hope you eventually find someone who would actually understand your situation rather than holding your achievements and privilege against you.

re: teal. i just based this off the mood app i was using back then but teal just means a normal day wkshjsh you're not particularly happy or sad, just an unremarkable day that you'd most likely forget xD it's a greenish blue colour.

"sometimes we’re one person away from having our life changed" OH. i love this so much!! (: you never know when one stranger could affect you even with just one conversation.

re: perfectionism. it goes hand in hand with anxiety, procrastination, and the fear of being seen and perceived xD what a complex human machine we are.

🌷 3096. Anonymous asked:
If you are seeing this then hi~

Coming from a reader who read every svt fics if yours; evergreen, glimpse of us, castle fires and swwa and to talk about what each of this fics taught me is to come out as a stronger and bolder person. Your characterisations, their stories, their room for development and how you focus more on their life story rather than smut and fluff is that secret ingredient which leaves a lasting impresaion of those words. As if we are growing older with evergreen seungcheol or castle fires jisoo taking up on life living everyday in monochrome yet somewhere we scream and crave for green(evergreen reference). The fight for survival the urge to know things that weren't meant to be known for us to accept the uncomfortable nd continue living with it to all those paths that led us to different places and all the people we met in the way where some mean good some mean nothing and rest mean bad everyone( CF jisoo ref) of those taught us a lesson. It's that this fics of yours saved me from accidental or potential heartbreaks I would know how to act in a strange situation it's a great insight to take onto those chapters of your life and pour onto your fictional friends. I took some really good lessons from your works and it's not about the fiction it's about how their story might be a real story of someone. Author's reply: hello :) <3 thank you so much! i read this cc yesterday and it made my day. i'm really happy my characters are a source of inspiration for you, albeit the struggles and bleakness of my works. it has always been my goal to write well realised characters and it warms my heart to know i did just that.

just want to remind you that your human experience will be very different from the characters written in these stories and it's definitely okay to discover things on your own! like hana said in evergreen, everyone's unique and that's the beauty of existing, don't you think so? :)

nice to meet you too and i hope you live life happily and with no regrets <3

🌷 3068. Anonymous asked:
Ik you don't do spoilers but couldn't help but ask you this before updating and continuing with the palace arc what something you want us readers to focus on like every thing in your fic CF are like a hidden puzzle a maze sometimes I get the answer while most of the time I am just mindlessly reading along😄 blame my comprehension skills but yeah I can't help but re read a lot so something you wanna specially mention to look forward to? Thank you and I'll be waiting eagerly for your next update. Stay safe >.<
Author's reply: oh i just want u guys to enjoy the story the way u want to :) i do put a lot of easter eggs and hints for major plot points, and i get a lot of my readers saying they need to turn on their brains when they read my works so they postpone reading updates sometimes hsjshjs but honestly, u don't need to! the story will unfold itself naturally.

if ure the type of reader who likes solving mysteries then look out for even the smallest details and descriptions (talk to me in the reviews because i discuss theories more thoroughly over there, or you can read my past discussions with other reviewers). but like i said, if u just read to have fun, don't fret, all those mysteries will reveal themselves in later chapters.

if u have a favourite character, maybe focus on how they react to their external environment and other characters they interact with :)

all characters have important roles in moving the story forward so that's more than thirteen characters including the oc's. all of them have an arc, and it's too much for a casual reader to take note of, so i really suggest reading it in a way you'd enjoy it :)

stay safe x

🌷 3038. Anonymous asked:
Now that you mentioned it, I'd also like to add, the use of colors as metaphors was genius. Author's reply: aaa u caught that! yes, this was intentional :) jisoo used to see his days as "red and green sand waiting to run out of time". it mirrors hana saying this was part of the human experience, that we can't always have green days but we can always have it again.

cue to jisoo, in the end, seeing it as something he can manage, not something he should drown in.

thank you for humouring me with these convos :') i really appreciate it

🌷 3019. Anonymous asked:
do you have some young adult book recommendation?

Thank you and have a nice day^^
Author's reply: sure! i remembered enjoying reading these:

- the hobbit

(cosy adventures. a classic! i have a link to a really great audiobook if you want)

- the hunger games trilogy

(im a basic bitch and this calls for a reread. u should read if u haven't yet)

- wayward children books

(grim dark series about children adjusting to the real world after going to magical dimensions.

can be read as standalones)

-----

if you're ready to commit to a large series, i highly recommend rick riordan's works

- he currently has 22 main books and 10+ supplementary books. he makes mythology enjoyable and accessible to a younger audience :)

- percy jackson and the olympians

(ik this is middle grade but if u haven't read this >:( )

- magnus chase trilogy

(YA. underrated!! my fave series of his after pjo.

norse myth. queer!mc and gender fluid!love interest. child of frey x child of loki)

- heroes of olympus

(YA; pentalogy after pjo. greek and roman myth)

attached below are his main books :D

-----

- six of crows duology

(six fugitives in a heist. well-written characters, they're all my babies)

- a knight of the seven kingdoms

(if you're a fan of asoiaf. kinda YA i guess, much more wholesome than the main series)

-----

i realised while writing they're all fantasy again lol ;A;

sorry i couldnt recommend more, i realised i just stuck with rick riordan when i was younger then shifted to adult fantasy lmaooo.. also these are mostly book series ;A; i could ask my book clubs for standalone recs if u want or if u're looking for specific genres (e.g, slice of life, romance) u can send a cc again :)

have a great week and happy reading~

September 19, 2023 12:56 PM
🌷 3014. Anonymous asked:
I'm curious if there's reason why you like darker tropes?
Author's reply: in terms of reading, i think there's a connotation in my brain that the darker the book, the greater the conflict (which shouldn't be the case, i know). and with that, i like picking apart plots and characters and symbolisms and metaphors and allegories, foreshadowings, and whatnot. it's like a brain exercise,, cures my restlessness. contemporary, slice of life most of the time bore me... im sorry ;A;

in terms of writing, life is so very bright and happy irl. i thirst for conflict lmaooo /j. on a serious note, i've done a lot of self introspection and observations in my day,,, for someone who has large friend groups, i like writing complex human emotions and how it affects their dynamics with the people around them. i like translating what i see irl into my writing. ~life imitates art~

tldr; i like reading and writing complexities and making things hard for characters yay~!
September 19, 2023 12:03 PM
🌷 3013. Anonymous asked:
TSOA & this is how you lose the time war 😌 taste
Author's reply: i'll be all the poets i'll kill them all and take each one's place in turn and every time love is written in all the strands it will be to you >:( i would know him in deatH, AT THE END OF THE WORLD--*punches the air*
September 19, 2023 11:33 AM
🌷 3012. Anonymous asked:
GL recommendations too please? ❤︎
Author's reply: disclaimer,, the following are novels, not manhwas/mangas :)

- this is how you lose the time war (space opera, scifi, well written purple prose)

- a dowry of blood (poly vampire clan with m/m, f/f, & m/f reps but the sapphic pair is most prominent)

- our wives under the sea (horror, self introspection, grief)

- the rise of kyoshi (great depiction of an extremist character. you'd enjoy this better if u watched atla)

- we are okay (mental health issues, introspection)

as u can see i mostly read dark gloomy works ;A; shjshjs !!pls read their warnings before reading!!
September 19, 2023 11:15 AM
🌷 3011. Anonymous asked:
Absolutely devoured castle fires, swwa and glimpse of us without leaving any crumbs, the delicacy leaves no room for dissatisfaction, heard you're updating on October so will wait for that one but for now I have two questions-----

1.What are some best tropes in bl fanfictions to read/write according to you?

2.Do recommend some m/m novels, stories where you get your inspo from....

**I am a writer myself but in writer's block so in dire need of getting up my hopes high to get back in form with some of your recommendations! Thank you ><
Author's reply: just a little bit of disclaimer; to tell you the truth, i'm not much of a fan of romance stories (the purely romance ones or those which have it as huge plot point). must be my aroace self speaking, but if you've noticed, my longer works focus on friendship dynamics and how the plot drives the relationships forward. i do write romances, though, that's undeniable. though, i try to establish a foundation/history between characters first. that's why when we get to the part where things finally fall *into place* it's much more worth it to read (in my pov, at least. i love making my characters suffer first. sorry swwa jihancheol).

i also mostly read fantasy stories and if i happen to read books in the lgbtqia+ spectrum, i usually read sapphic or aroace reps.

anyway!!! that being said, i'll still answer your questions shjshs

1. as ive said, i don't read much romance driven works ;A; so, i haven't really delved much into bl ones either. but for romance tropes in general, i like friends to lovers, or, enemies to lovers, or childhood friends to lovers,, anything that gives two characters existing dynamic depth to work with. just a personal preference! i'm a writer who focuses on dynamics, after all :) perhaps your strength in tropes differ from mine.

2. for plots and writing, in general, i get inspiration from the works of George R.R. Martin, J.R.R. Tolkien, and other high fantasy authors. (i haven't read any of Brandon Sanderson works *yet*, but his writing course is uploaded for free in youtube. i listen to it while working. you should check it out!)

mlm ones i did read:

- The Song of Achilles (beautiful retelling of the Trojan War - Rated M)

- Heartstopper (cute fluffy comics. really fast read - Rated T)

- The House in the Cerulean Sea (cute with some heart wrenching moments - Rated T)

asked my mlm friends for recos as well. i trust their taste enough to share their recs sksk

- Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe (my bestfriend said this is one of his fave books)

- Carry On trilogy by Rainbow Rowell ('and they were roommates' trope but make it about wizards. pretty sure this was inspired by Drarry)

- Red, White, and Royal Blue (yes that one movie that's blowing up rn. my friend rated this four stars tho)

- Simon vs the Homo Sapiens Agenda (ive seen the movie, it's really nice. friend said book is great too)

- Two Boys Kissing (idek what this is about. friend said just read it)

thank you for reading my works :') hope these recs will help you!! have fun reading and writing <3

August 31, 2023 12:59 PM
🌷 2997. Anonymous asked:
Hi miss badge! How are you? I'm part of your priv circles and saw tweets about your work. I wanted to ask what's your work and how you chose it? Only if it's not too personal. I'm sorta confused because of your carrd 🥲 It's okay if you ignore that part. And lastly if it's okay with you can you give any tips for someone choosing a field of study.

Thank you!!! ILYSM

P.S. can't wait for your ao3 updates ❤️
Author's reply: hello~ i'm good i'm good. hope you're well, too. don't hesitate to reply in circles :) we can talk there as well sksk

hmm not gonna be too specific but i work for the music industry, engineering side of things. i have an engineering degree so it's expected of me to work in tech. chose the degree cos i liked problem-solving as a kid (and the money that comes with it).

some thoughts on the tech industry;

it took me around three years to settle down and be happy with my field. take note that the tech industry is so very large. it's not just knowing how to code and build things. for me, i mostly focus on user psychology, art, and design (helps me with writing too! cos i get to incorporate these thought processes in my characters) but i do write code as well which is /highly/ profitable (if u saw my circles tweets then yk). the tech industry pays really well and u got lots of personal time (i work four hours max per day). it's a hit or miss though,,, i think having the right connections plays a large role.

some advice;

if ure still in high school going to uni, build connections in uni! can not emphasise that enough.

for choosing a field, it would be naive for me to say 'follow your heart' or 'choose the one that would make you happy' because not everyone could afford that. i say choose what's most convenient for you /at the moment/ and something you can tolerate /if it comes down to it/. choosing a degree program that u know would make u miserable is a recipe for a lot of mental health issues which will most likely make you change degrees anyway (ive seen way too many of my friends do this).

if you're one of the lucky ones who have the privilege of exploring different degree programs, then don't take your time and privilege for granted. explore and find what's best fit for you; take electives, take introduction courses. remember that what you chose during your senior year of high school can be changed. you can even change your career path after uni (that's what a lot of people i know did,, those who got money from the tech industry and shifted careers when they were able to do so.)

nyway. you don't have to figure it out immediately. you just have to do what's best for your situation atm. ily2 good luck~ and see u in ao3! don't hesitate to reply in cc again :)
July 21, 2023 09:43 AM

so if u want any specific character explanations/how i view them, we can discuss them in ao3 reviews :)

July 02, 2023 05:03 PM
🌷 2971. Anonymous asked:
thank you :’) may i know what u mean by self reliance and self sabotage? and if it doesn’t bother u, any further thoughts about this topic?
Author's reply: oh well, self-reliance isn't necessarily bad. but too much of it can be :) most of the time, self-deprecation, i think, stems from unhealed past traumas/experiences with regard to relationships/friendships. people who do this tend to think they're unworthy of love, or like you said, do not believe others are capable of loving who they are. perhaps in some cases, insecurity can be a factor, too. those are just some surface-level things as it's unique from one person to the other.

re: thoughts on self-reliance and self-sabotage

individualists (like myself) tend to put up a wall other people can not cross (regardless of the number of friends and acquaintances). i hated asking other people for help, and i tried to do everything on my own. which isn't exactly healthy, as building intimate and deep relationships is part of the human experience. i used to decline help (self-sabotage), because i didn't want to be a burden to anybody else. but we have to understand that these people who reach out to us, do this because they care for us and they love us. i didn't understand it then.

anyway, my wake-up call was a very long talk with one of my friends and a therapy session lmaoshjsh it's still hard for me to acknowledge and accept all the love people give me. i still think myself unworthy of it. and im still trying to tell myself that i can take a bigger space in this world, a place in someone else's heart. eh, i'll get there xD i hope you will too!

idk if anything made sense shjsh it's late where im from xD don't hesitate to reply again. i sincerely hope you're okay :)
July 02, 2023 04:52 PM
🌷 2970. Anonymous asked:
welp u were right self deprecation does blind us from seeing other’s love for us it’s literally seeing feeling but still not believing
Author's reply: hope youre okay anon :') i'm still learning too~ we just have to push past that wall of self-reliance and self-sabotage. fighting! baby steps :)

🌷 2961. ashxstry asked:
'Jeonghan tilted his head, the way Haeun does, the way he does.' - bruh now i want babies

How do I even start to write my thoughts about this whole time travel stuff....? I just- I'm all in, okay?! >:( I love this too much I'm getting mad lmao how did you even write a story about this whole comforting idea of seeing your life in the future, and I love that it's almost like talking to your future/past self to tell them what they need to know to keep going. I've been entertaining the idea for so long; what would I say to my past self? What would I say to my future self? I love writing letters to my future self just to see how much I've grown and how insignificant my worries were when I was younger. I would love to travel and tell them to not worry because it'll be fine, you'll be *amazing*.

And that's /exactly/ what you've did with glimpse of us. Him getting to watch glimpse of them in the future, happy, smiling, *strong*- what can be more comforting than that?? Having the idea written down as a story brings so much joy to me u have no idea ;A;

'“You’ll know,” Jisoo whispered against his lips. “You’ll know.” He smiled, repeating it with certainty.

Jisoo forgot when birthdays started to feel dreadful. But this.. he’ll remember this....'

It's so satisfying and fulfilling, the way you call back and wrapped the whole story and answered back to all the questions just *chef kiss* that confidence in "you'll know" that quote future Jeonghan and future himself, a future that he /will/ have, the moon and the seas, and the letting go. And now his birthday will be painted with the memory of this. It's just- a very significant moment of breakthrough that he'll remember whenever things get hard, and it's comforting. This whole story is just comforting. I'll probably think of this fic when things get hard.

Author's reply: lmaoo actually, 'glimpse of us' was an idea after i read my journal from ten years ago~ ^^ somewhere in it, child me wrote, "i hope when you read this again in ten years, you're finally genuinely happy." and i thought "guuuurl u gonna go through a lot of shit but hey we're still here!!" sdfjkhfjksdh

i can't say i was happy all throughout the past ten years. but i actually had a laugh thinking back, cos everything that happened to me, made me the person i am now. and i wouldn't change anything tbh. i wouldn't learn if i was just happy. life had to shove me to the ground somehow (e.g, dreading birthdays, grieving friends who aren't here anymore etc.) but also experiencing being loved and feeling that love every single day.

acknowledgement, honouring emotions, and coming to terms with them; just because you're merely floating at the moment doesn't mean the tides won't carry you high and low again :)

am i genuinely happy? pretty much yeah. do i still spiral every once in a while, of fucking course woohoo!!!!!

that's what 'glimpse of us' entails for me. there won't always be a light at the end of the tunnel, but light can be sparked at any point in the darkness ^^ thanks for reading and talking to me, muse <3 im glad you like the fic!!

🌷 2956. ashxstry asked:
I absolutely lurvee that moon and sea metaphor! 'Of knowing the moon more than what’s beneath the seas.' Their babies are so smart asdjlsajkss cuties

'“It’s like you’re seeing him for the first time,”

“How so?”

“It’s the same way he looks at you every time.”

“Even before?”

“Way before,” “you were too blinded by your own self-deprecation to see.”

“And now?” “how do you think I see myself?”

“Like how he sees you.”'

I cry this is so beautiful I'm all for self love but this- a love that makes you love yourself more - i luv u for writing this scene ;A;

I have a brother (casually starting another long monologue), and yesterday was his first marriage anniversary. It still shock me nowadays, knowing that my brother who never remember my age, celebrating an anniversary. Our family never celebrates things. But my sister-in-law's family celebrates everything. She was raised in an openly affectionate and loving family (as far as I know). Seeing my brother being openly affectionate to his wife, it's just strange lmao.

My point is, I think love has to be learned. And what's the best way to learn other being loved by the right person? Sometimes you just have to experience love in order to love back. People say you have to love yourself before you can love someone else. But how can we love ourselves if we have no idea how? Due to my self learning tendency, I learned to love myself with the ideal type of love- unconditional love- and found myself loving others with the same idea only to find out how toxic it was. Loving, caring, kindness- it takes interactions with people to do things right.
Author's reply: interpret the sea and moon metaphors however you want to~ but yes, what i intended was close to how you interpreted it :)

pls i always write about self love and introspection and figuring things out on your own but i need a character to realise they're more than what they see in the mirror through someone else's glasses :') they have to have someone else spell it out for them because the self deprecation is consuming them wkshjsh jisoo's light bulb moment when cheol said, "like how he sees you"--ugh i love it. i love their friendship in this.

re: your brother. awh that's so cute though shjsh it's always so nice seeing someone in another light.

re: learning emotions

i agree, though i can only speak from experience. you can learn a lot of things on your own/in theory but there are specific emotions you can only learn and unlearn when dealing with relationships/friendships/family and that includes love ^^ love itself is complex and the media portrays it as sunshine and rainbows when in reality it's dealing with everything that comes with it including compromise and pain.
April 08, 2023 11:11 AM
🌷 2955. ashxstry asked:
hello miss! I finally got around my procrastination hehe here are glimpse of us thoughts! its been living in my head rent free

'Jisoo forgot when birthdays started to feel like a biological time bomb of personal expectations. He didn’t look forward to them; dreaded them, to be honest.'

First line and I already feel attacked my gosh... I guess this is not a unique experience (at this point no such experience exists I think), but yea birthdays used to be so hard to me and this is exactly what goes through my mind each time. On birthday it's just hardd to feel loved, harder than normal days, and it's harder because my family isn't really into date-celebration things. there's nothing special about birthday, they'd say, and as much as I hope that's true and not hope for anything, I just couldn't. maybe because of social media and because I have friends that celebrate theirs festively, and every year I watched my best friends receive so many gifts at school she literally couldn't fit them in her bag (hot people things), she even received whole cake(s) from idk who. after all that, I guess it's inevitable that I hated not getting even one cake or one gift from my own family.

This Jisoo dreads his birthday because he feels useless. I hated mine because I love myself, but no one seemed to love me. Made me question whether my self love was misplaced, because why else made me deserve the neglect?

Yet every year, I forced myself to feel okay. I convinced myself that birthday doesn't mean anything (even though others' birthday means so much to me). Despite all those handcrafted gifts and heartfelt letters I send to every of my precious friends, I only find myself reading a letter from myself to myself and buying cake myself (unconditional self love be peeking through). But you know, I really wasn't fine. Be it words of affirmation, act of service or gifts (quality time and physical touch already disqualified at this point) , I feel unloved in every language possible on my birthday.

It was 2 years ago that I finally accepted that I hated my birthday. I validated my own dread, I cried and worried of it and wished it will never come. I was in a particularly bad place at that time. Long story short (it's too long already) it wasn't that bad. It's just- I realized that I love people that I love so deeply and with my whole heart that I couldn't see any love that's less than that. I couldn't /feel/ love that's less than that. It's unfair, for both them and me, because their best efforts were never on par with my best efforts. And I was never comfortable with the idea of *asking* because begging for love is just pathetic. But u know what? I've grown and I've realized that's life is simpler than what I made up in my head lmao and I realized I should've just told them. That what I want for my birthdays is just a cute long essays of why they love me XD

Naurr this is too long for just that one line ;A;
Author's reply: hello muse~ i finally answered this!!! oml i hope you're doing well and hopefully u got some rest after your finals :)

re:birthdays

well fuck. where do i even begin with this one. i feel like every time you talk to me about personal things, i always see a younger version of myself. just xntj things :')

i understand the feeling of giving more love than what's received and it sucks. even though we tell ourselves to love unconditionally, there are still moments when we second guess if the love we give is taken for granted. i'm really sorry you had to go through that, muse. i assure you, that wanting to have the love you give reciprocated is completely normal.

i'm not familiar with your friends, but a similar realisation happened to me years ago, too. for someone whose love language is words, i didn't understand how my childhood friends couldn't /understand/ me. my brain needs to be constantly stimulated; i like critical discussions, debates, literature, etc. and they couldn't provide me that. the older i got, the more i realised how love languages play a part in all of this. like you said, just the right amount of communication and meeting halfway could resolve this but it's easier said than done shjsh it's a lot of trial and error in our part. a lot of misunderstandings, still. but that's how relationships work :) if you want to keep them, you put in the work. i also realised i have other friend groups more fit for brain stimulating activities i wanted. it doesn't mean i love my childhood friends any less, it just means i love them a different way.

i always say this too; how people think romantic relationships are hard to sustain. in reality, that's how it goes for all relationships, especially friendships.

food for thought, something a close friend told me recently:

we 'like' because, and we 'love' despite.

i hope u enjoy your birthday this year, muse <3 enjoy it however way you want to :)

🌷 2952. Anonymous asked:
WAIT.

Not anon but you have a child? 😮 that explains why you're always busy... curious as what Life as we know it is too....
Author's reply: uhm not biologically ;A; some readers from my past acc already know this since they've been with me during this time;

my bestfriend passed away when her child was just a toddler, and i was designated as a primary godparent (along with two of my godchild's uncles). though my godchild doesn't stay with me, i do my best to be present in her life as a mother figure (tbh my role is the cool godparent but let's pretend i'm more maternal). so yea, im busy with other things too but spending time with my godchild is a priority during my free time :)

i wrote a fic inspired by this (life as we know it, named after the movie with a loosely similar premise). the fic focused on each characters' healing process, picking oneself up after a loved one's death, and responsibilities as a pseudo-parent/co-parent. while writing, i realised i haven't come to terms with grief and used writing as a deflection mechanism, which then spiralled into a very long hiatus, inevitably, making it the last work in that writing acc.

im doing better now though~ i might write a new fic about my thoughts on grief and grieving again (it took a lot of introspection and therapy lol). however, i don't think i'll rewrite lawki despite it being a well-loved fic :)

April 08, 2023 09:28 AM
🌷 2950. Anonymous asked:
genuine question, what's your motivation to write?
Author's reply: i like talking about plots and characters. engaging me in discussions about fic theories, thoughts about character development and how they navigate or drive the plot themselves. these motivate me a lot to update since i want to see the reactions when reviewers guess plot points correctly ^^ it's always fun reading them. of course, any reaction is fun to read :) even ones that say 'my brain's too fried for this but i like the part where ___'

clout is nice since a reach gives you more audience to talk to. however, i'm already content if i get to talk to a few regular readers/reviewers or some popping up to comment from time to time. so gaining more audience is a plus, not a goal.

i also write to improve sentence structures, syntax, and writing style. i think of writing fics as a practice so seeing my writing progress is also a huge motivator :)

🌷 2925. Anonymous asked:
Different anon, but Percy Jackson is so good! I’ve still not read the last book, but the rest of the series that I did read was amazing.

Anyway I am curious about something. Do you pick up on the way people type therefore able to tell when it’s the same anon even though we’re anonymous?
Author's reply: omggg yass <3 last book from the main series (the last olympian)? oh, you're going to love it ^^~ the final battle was *chef's kiss*. though my fave book of the series is battle of the labyrinth <3

re: anons. i pick up on some context clues but this isn't a hundred percent accurate cos ive been proven wrong before lmfaooo i have some funny stories about tryin to guess anons when readers talk to me in reviews/msgs. tho! i did have my fair share of correct guesses ;) i became close oomfs with more than 10 anons in my other fandom and guessed 85% of them correctly dhjdh

i do sometimes follow the patterns of how u guys write (capitalisations, punctuations, tones, emojis frequently used, words, etc.) and i also take note of your preferences in my characters/character dynamics/plot lines (some anons tend to continue cc's about their chapter update thoughts without replying to their main cc and i just connect the dots). i also remember more personal cc's and wait if there are updates hjsjhs (e.g, advice about personal lives, writing, conversations about our interests [i'll remember these pjo convos for sure aha youre now dubbed as Last Olympian anon in my brain]). im known to give nicknames for those who frequently drop by ^^ or u make ur cc's distinct (e.g, white heart, fox anon, astrology anon, that one anon who calls me cutie, comet anon, raindrop, etc.) i also notice when new anons go through the recent answers because they unconsciously adapt some words sent by recent cc's/reviews hehe :D

i think in caratland im quite positive i know who ~4-5 regular anons are based on tones, story preferences, and convos... also, idk if u guys know but cc notifies me who likes the cc's.. xD it also shows how long ago it was sent and half of the time cc's coincide with ao3 reviews or twitter mentions. they're clumped up in my notifs so i see the username/s especially for new readers because they tend to start with "i just discovered your story" and then id receive a new review in ao3 vice versa. or cc would notify someone just liked some answers /then/ i'd get a cc shortly.

of course, i could be wrong and maybe some readers just like camping here hsjsh but it's still a fave past time of mine to guess for myself who u guys are xD since i find some convos rlly cute and they make my day hehe

(watch anons try to write differently/stop liking cc's after seeing this dskjfhsd pls dONTT ure going to mess up the database in my brain /lh ur ccs are cute i swear and my guesses stay with me or between us >< wkshj)

ps. if ure curious cos i answered a recent cc "guessing ure the same anon", it's because the last parts of their cc's are exactly the same and were sent minutes apart ahaha

pps, sorry if i rambled a lot. i had a lot of time to spare while waiting for a meeting shsj have a great week <3

🌷 2923. Anonymous asked:
LMAO yeah i meant MARCH 😭 i was panicking when i reread my question after u answered too bc how the heck we reach may alr, lol im so sorry

ohh actually about pjo, i read the greek gods first,, is that messing up the order or??

Author's reply: lmaoshjs no need to apologise ^^ yes, yes, march aaa~ february flew by so fast.

re: greek gods, i don't think it will since it's a collection of classic myth retelling through percy's pov. can't remember much since i read it years ago, there might be inside jokes and references regarding the main series but i still think you can read it as a standalone :D also, it's a nice way to get familiar with percy's tone and voice (the main character of rick riordan's main series). so yeah! i don't think it'll mess up your reading experience :) if you just want to know the mythologies and stories, that's a great start! rick also has another book, "Greek Heroes" if ure interested in other mythology figures :D (icarus, the myth about the boy who flew too close to the sun [discussed in swwa ch 8] is in here~)

if you plan on eventually reading the main series, you still get to know the gods and goddesses the same time as him cos he's clueless about everything xD but since ure reading greek gods, you now know more than him in the beginning of the series and u get to laugh at him /lh ^^ he's our silly goofy bestie. have fun reading <3

February 20, 2023 08:32 AM
🌷 2912. Anonymous asked:
Hi Badge!! Just curious as to how you actually like write your oneshots. Is it like all in one sitting, or spread out over time? If it one random thought that it not super fleshed out but you just roll with it, or do you have a at least halfy planned out way of how it’s going to go? I never know how I should do it so I figured I’d ask someone I’d trust and whose writing style is amazing!!
Author's reply: my one-shot processes are different each time but see which of the following will work for you!

*) before i start writing my one-shots, i have a word document with all the one-shots i want to write. the summaries are already in there as well as important plot points until the endings. though not everything is definite, it helps with the flow once i start writing a particular fic.

1) spread out

i'm still in the experimentation phase of this but i'm trying to have a daily/every other day writing routine. i dedicate maybe 3-4 hours just writing with breaks (check hourly pomodoro technique). this includes everything from writing an outline, filling out paragraphs, editing, etc. and it's spread out over the week. obviously, i'm still grasping at this since i'm not able to churn out updates every week, but this one will work best long term for my busy schedule ++ this will prevent u from having a burnout.

2) one sitting

i do write in one sitting. when i'm freer from irl, i dedicate a day to just writing and most of the time when i do this, i end up with an ~8k word document. most times, i'm satisfied with this and just post what i have. but the cons of this is you'd get tired/burned out by the end of the day and would find it hard to bounce back again cos you'll associate exhaustion with writing, unless you're already used to writing in general. (pls take note i used to have a gruelling writing routine during quarantine so i'm comfortable with this practice, but i could see how this would be hard for others)

*) my actual process rn

alas, as much as i want to hold onto some routines, i just can't at the moment. i try to do 1) but since i'm busy, i mostly end up with 2) lmfaoooo. though i'm tryin to change that.

cc has a character limit--i'll reply with part 2 -> https://curiouscat.live/hongrang8/post/1307321522
February 20, 2023 08:13 AM
🌷 2911. aeirborne asked:
re: writing one shots part 2 cos of character limit lol
Author's reply: re: plot structures

*) the architect and the gardener

writers tend to fall into two different types; those who do best with outline writing (architects), and those who write better while going with the flow (gardeners). architects plan out writings until their epilogues and have a writing style where they drop hints, premonitions, and foreshadowing, making it a different type of read for the readers during their rereads. meanwhile, gardeners explore their stories as they write them.

*) my plot while writing

for one shots, though i have summaries and outlines, i'm flexible in changing them as i write the fics if i think some situations, dialogues, characterizations, or paragraphs suit the theme better. i don't /try/ my best to stick to my original plans, i do what i think best fits what i'm writing. (pls take note that i'm a writer who mainly focuses on characterizations and plots, [but] one-shots give more of a leeway with this. think of it as a rest for my brain vs my heavily structured chaptered fics XD). with one-shots, i tend to lean towards the gardener.

for my chaptered fics,,, well,,, i'm known as the foreshadower so i'm heavily in the architect archetype when it comes to them.

tldr; you can be both a gardener and an architect. it depends on what type of fic you're trying to do and what suits your writing routine better :) just remember that writing fics is supposed to be an enjoyment, not a chore <3 trial and error is the best way to find what works best for you :) good luck and happy writing~ don't hesitate to drop by again if u have further questions
February 20, 2023 08:05 AM

February 13, 2023 01:17 PM
🌷 2891. Anonymous asked:
different anon here. also a fan of GOT and your writing! can i ask what this is about?
Author's reply: omgg thank you :') it's a canon-divergent fic focusing on the magic system :D the main character's canonical death still happens but is resurrected by a god. mc becomes the god's champion and a ripple effect across the continent happens since other gods emerge from dormancy. mc becomes trapped in the god's debt ("only death can pay for life") despite not wanting to be resurrected in the first place ++ their whole family and the person who killed them believe they're dead; so they take on an entirely different identity and train in the shadows to become a fighter instead of a politician. the drowned god's words "what is dead may never die; but rises again harder and stronger" is the theme of the fic :)

the moral dilemma in the fic is where the mc's loyalties lie, since they're not a key player in the political civil war anymore; they're an entirely different being. what cause do they fight for? what will they do with the godly gifts given to them? will they go after the character who once killed them?

basically a "demigods" fic in the universe with multiple key players ^^

dk if that made sense. feel free to ask questions!
February 12, 2023 07:20 AM

Author's reply: it's a wip from one of my book fandoms,, i only posted the prologue ^^ (hint: you can google the phrase). if you're interested, i can link you it when the updates start later this year :)

February 07, 2023 07:49 AM
🌷 2878. Anonymous asked:
Hi! I just wanted to ask how you link your twt and stuff in the notes on ao3. I’m relatively new to writing on there and wanted to do it myself lol
Author's reply: hi~ on the chapter end notes, follow the html code below:

<a href="[URL]"> text to be linked </a>

example, if i wanted something to link back to my twitter & cc:

socials: <a href="https://www.twitter.com/hongrang8"> twt </a> and <a href="https://www.curiouscat.live/hongrang8"> cc </a>

it will show up like the photo attached below. hope this helped! :) you can also tweak the end notes with supported html tags. u can look it up :D have fun!

January 13, 2023 01:22 PM
🌷 2853. Anonymous asked:
Can you pls tell the reason why you won't write for trsr anymore? Is it bcz you lost interest in them or some other reason??
Author's reply: most of my older readers know this, but i wasn't in an okay mental space when i started writing for trsr (why i started and stopped). it's a whole iceberg i don't wanna discuss anymore since it's been two years but i've healed already dw! another reason is that i did try to go back to writing for trsr but it felt really different for me since most of my close moots/oomfs aren't in stantwt anymore. it just felt empty without them ig.

other reasons as well being, i mostly write narratives, focus on world-building, fantasy plotlines, etc. which i don't think a lot of teume readers are interested in (i always ended up discontinuing my works because nobody talks to me about them.... ;A; my main motivation to write is to have someone to talk to). i feel like soc med au's are more palatable and i did fall into this trap before but they're just not my thing.

i still support the boys, i do drop by to see what theyve been up to. literally has got nothing to do with them, but writing for them isn't something i'd see myself go back to anytime soon.

tldr; mental space i associated it with, my oomfies r gone, i have a lot of fantasy narratives planned [and] want to talk abt with readers

🌷 2812. Anonymous asked:
You don't seem like a baby carat at all 😮 since when were you a carat if you don't mind answering
Author's reply: so ive been told >.< ive actually been a casual listener since '17 so im familiar with the members even way back (one of the few kpop groups whose discography i could play on shuffle + some close friends are carats). i had rock with you on repeat for an unhealthy amount of time during that cb tho and ig youtube picked up on it so it recced me gose, specifically the ego episode.

didn't think much before clicking because i do watch random kpop variety shows even with groups i don't stan. the thing about me is that, i'm a sucker for good plot and lore and theories and brEH that episode got me fucking hooked because it's self-contained within two episodes but enough of a time to let the viewers see how each members' personalities shine. not to mention the quality of the production. i spiraled from there and watched bad clue, one million won, don't lie, etc.

so yeah i was initially sucked in as a cubic and during that time i was in a very long writing hiatus. my impulsive ass went 'hey! u like mingyu and wonwoo in that ego episode! u like the oldest hyungs' dynamics! why don't u give the hogwarts plot to them' and thus swwa was born a week later

December 03, 2022 12:01 PM
🌷 2766. aeirborne asked:
pt 2. re: complex characters
Author's reply: wrote a whole essay and cc apparently has character limit lol ;A; anyway-

- critical thinking & deep intimate relationships: intellectual conversations and exchange of opinion through healthy debates helped a lot in my understanding of the people around me. my friends and i often discuss philosophy and morally ambiguous questions. which will then reflect our morals, challenge each other's beliefs, act as the other's devil's advocate etc. the reason why most if not all of my characters seem like well-realized people, because they are in fact, patterned after the thought processes of real people. i often ask myself, "if [my friend] was in this conversation what would they say? what would they do? what are the nuances in their actions, in the way they speak, their internal monologue, their purpose?"

broadening your perspective, seeing the world in another person's shoes, and eliminating your biases make way for an array of different-sounding characters on your plate.

[choosing when to write complex characters]

- personally, i like reading morally grey stories because it gives a glimpse of human mistakes and tragedy. HOWEVER, i don't think this level of depth is applicable to all stories, especially light-hearted fanfiction.

- usually, complexity is seen in longer works as writers often dive deep into the character's nuances and monologue. so ask yourself first, are you writing a shorter fic or a long multi-chaptered one? does the character's complexity drive the story forward, or is it a filler?

- personally, tropes are a really great way to start your character ++ u can play with the traits like a sandbox. some characters don't have to be this well-realized complex character,,, and that's fine. characters and plot go hand in hand. if the plot tone doesn't call for this level of intricacy, you /can/ still write enjoyable characters without all this research.

at the end of the day, what matters is your own enjoyment and fulfilment in writing. hope this helped and if u have any more questions feel free to drop by :) happy writing!
December 03, 2022 09:18 AM
🌷 2765. Anonymous asked:
Hi jihour! I hope you're doing well <33 I just wanted to let you know I'm thinking of creating my own writing account after thinking about it for a very long time (I told you this before in curiouscat but I got busy and started to pick up writing again recently). Do you have any tips in writing a character? I've always loved the way you write yours and how you make them flawed and well characterized. Thank you for being an inspiration to a lot of us! always rooting for you, miss <3
Author's reply: this answer is long overdue, i'm really sorry about that ;A; i hope you still see this. anyway. shsh okay writing characters in depth.

pls note i am far from being a professional writer and have taken zero writing classes. i'm going to list down things that worked /for me/. perhaps u can pick up some ideas that would suit your writing below. take what's applicable /for you/ and leave those that aren't :)

[on your own]

- sense of self/introspection: one of the most basic foundations of writing a complex character is being able to understand what makes a character well realized. luckily for everyone, there's a readily available complex human to pick apart; yourself!! and even if you don't want to pattern a character after you/your experiences, you can always pattern your thought processes as you self-introspect.

what are their basic traits? (what are you known for?) how do other characters perceive them? (how do your close friends see you?) what's their inner monologue? (what are you thinking during certain life events?) does it align with their actions? (do you act upon them or do you keep them to yourself?) what are their motivations in the story? (what makes you do things purposefully?)

- reading: read, read, and read. reading gives you perspective on how different authors write their characters. take note of character points that caught your attention and reflect on what you would want to improve should you be the one writing the characters. picking apart characters to see the layers upon layers beneath their actions is a good exercise too. writing a character study after reading a novel/work you really like also helps in empathizing and understanding how a complex character is made.

[other influences]

- talking to people: make it a point to learn from the person you're talking to, whether it's an acquaintance or a close friend. keep in mind, that everyone around you knows something you don't. these conversations often lead you to reflect on your own biases and are a great way to empathize with people from different walks of life. and empathizing as we know, is a step toward making a character feel more authentic in their writing.

September 13, 2022 10:16 AM
🌷 2680. ashxstry asked:
hi miss! it’s muse :3 idk if you noticed but i’m reading through your update slowly rn

the truth is, i’ve been quite distracted with a lot of thoughts and overthinking stuffs in my life so i couldn’t read much these days ;A; i love reading your cc, and i found great perspectives in here, so i want to rant a bit hehe

recently, i received the perfect marks for my pre-university courses(i was the only one in my school), went up stages for awards etc, lots of people been congratulating me left and right. but instead of feeling happy, there’s this looming fear since i got my result. the thing that bothers me the most is; what now? as much as i want to take it step by step and slowly figure out, i have to choose what to further in university asap. people been telling me how lucky i am because i will probably be accepted wherever i apply to, but idk, i just have no idea what to do with my life

nowadays i hate the word ‘passion’, because people push it on my face too much lmao

it’s quite ironic - to feel like a failure when all i obtained was success. idk, i’m just too uninterested in science and technology (and people are mad at me bcs of that) and the things i am interested in, is apparently ‘a waste of my potential ‘

do you think there is such thing as ‘wasted potential’?

and yknow, i am also afraid that my ‘interest’ is just a fleeting curiosity because of my youth and my lack of research and thinking things through (even tho i think i am currently overthinking), i hate to think that one day i might quit and they’ll say ‘i told you so’

i am terribly anxious for the future rn, and if i could ask for the best ending, it will be one where i have my peace of mind :)) wealth, status, popularity - i just want to be content with who i am :’)

oh and the weird thing is, i’m not sure if ‘people’ and ‘they’ i mentioned above are real, or just me being too hard on myself. seriously, it’s been confusing me for quite a while now.

feels great to rant here :D would love it if you can offer some advices/comments/whatever perspective you can offer because honestly, i am backed against the wall lately haha

that’s it :3 thank you for reading luv u <3
Author's reply: hewo~ take your time, muse!! glad my cc's is a safe haven for you :)

well first of all, damn, congratulations!! you deserve to feel happy for your achievements :D if there's one thing i learned during times like those, it's to remind myself that i'm allowed to be happy for the hard work i've done. it's only me that's refraining myself from being mindful of positive emotions. let it flow to you and embrace your success. rewarding yourself shouldn't feel like a punishment :)

lmaoo a lot of what you said felt like it was ghost written by younger me pre-university.

unlike you, however, i didn't know what my passion was as a teenager. i've always said i love science and maths as much as i love arts and literature, which gave me options. and the option i took was to be a competitive motherfucker and take an engineering degree to prove to everyone that girls can survive a male dominated field. also it paid fucking well. aaaaaaaand it made me miserable :D what i want you to learn from this, is to think thoroughly /why/ you want to pursue each option you have. it goes back to my principle of being purposeful with all your actions. weigh all the pros and cons. at this point in time, it's okay to feel confused and it's okay to make mistakes. just learn not to blame yourself and stand back up should hurdles come your way.

i feel like you already know what you want though, based on your cc. so the next step for this, is to ask yourself, 'is this feasible?' a lot of people are restrained by their circumstances, most often than not financially. if you feel that you're privileged enough to pursue what you want, then, i say go for it.

i don't think there's such a thing as wasted potential, as long as you hone it. just because you will pursue a certain track in university doesn't mean you can't pursue other activities in the future. life isn't meant to be that way as humans are multifaceted. there are many avenues for you to learn, such as community events, online courses with certifications, and joining organizations. learning doesn't stop at university and you can always be a student for life.

one thing to note about your cc is you need to remind yourself that you don't owe anyone your choices. and whatever they say about it is negligible (e.g, 'i told u so'). living for somebody else's dream or opinion will most likely make you miserable, and have a strained relationship with them as these are formative years of your life. receive and learn from constructive criticism, and throw away unwanted ones.

at the end of the day, i'm just a stranger in the internet and i know deep down, you already know what's best for you :) peace of mind, as you said.

you're young, you're not running against the clock and you never will be. don't be afraid to make choices and make mistakes. with mistakes, you'll learn, and by learning you'll grow.

cheers, muse :) ily2 <3
September 13, 2022 10:15 AM
🌷 2679. Anonymous asked:
Have you ever feel like you’re different?

For some unexplainable reasons, I’ve always feel like I was different. Strange, weird even. Like I don't fit in wherever I go, and it makes me feel so lonely sometimes…

Idk, can I get your opinion on this?
Author's reply: this is a broad question aha

yes i have, when i was younger.

to put it quite simply (without trauma dumping on u lol), i'm actually one of the most sociable people irl. but loneliness comes in different forms i believe. i may have had fifty friends, but at the end of the day, at a young age, i was developing mental health issues, which granted i didn't understand during that time. and it made me feel isolated when nobody around me understood how it felt regardless if i was surrounded by dozens of people. i felt different and lonely that way. luckily, when i entered university, mental health isn't as taboo to talk about.

aside from that, i created a writing account because none of my fifty friends liked writing lol, and look where it got me. i met this very lovely community :) there are as many personalities as the seven billion people in this world after all, and i assure you that somewhere out there, people will be as weird and different as you. i hope that by reading that, you don't feel as alone.. even just a little bit :)

one of my favorite youtube channels just posted about loneliness, so i'll drop it here. https://youtu.be/I9hJ_Rux9y0

you may not relate to that by the way. i can only ever work on the cc you sent, but please don't hesitate to reach out again should u want to :) fighting, anon~
September 13, 2022 07:47 AM
🌷 2678. Anonymous asked:
Hi! Do you always stick to your original character sketches or they just change as you write your chapters? I feel like mine almost always end up completely different from where I started.😕
Author's reply: edit: ok so i just looked up what character sketches mean im sorry ;A;

the short answer is, yes, they change as i write the chapters.

the long answer is, yes i change them because they're intended to. for someone like me who's very heavy on characterization and plot, i make it a point to portray their growth throughout the chapters. if you've read my works, most if not all of my main characters have a trait they need to improve on/learn from.

i think asking yourself the purpose of the characters during the first draft would help :) if it's a feel good genre or a short fic, i think it's better to stick with the original sketch. but if u intend on writing a longer story, just be wary that the changes should be gradual and purposeful. the readers need to understand where the shift in characterization came from. and it should serve and tie your intended plot. in the readers' pov, they still need to understand that it's the same character, just evolving with the story.

hope that helped~ don't hesitate to ask me more here if my answer didn't make sense ahsha

September 06, 2022 02:16 AM
🌷 2673. Anonymous asked:
how do you stay motivated to write? i really want to but like the other anon ive been putting it off
Author's reply: welp *cracks knuckles* looks like a lot of us aren't motivated these days

i don't know if you've been with me from before, but way back then, i used to write everyday left and write; just work, write, sleep. because i love writing and i love the community, but eventually that lifestyle burnt me out. of course, there were a lot of other factors for my hiatus, but ig that's a big contributor. don't just write for the sake of updating. it will show in your writing and it will tire you out. we all have our "update schedule" goals but be kind to yourself when you don't meet them :)

second, i'm always outside of stantwt. i hyperfixate on a lot of things (games, books, songs, intellectual conversations), and i find writing inspo through them, though that isn't my intention. happy accidents, if you may. i have this one word document just full of random dialogues, quotes, metaphors, etc. and going through them when i have the time always does the trick to make me write down some narratives. just pushing through that initial resistance would lead me to write non-stop. don't focus on perfection the first time you write the draft, just the structure is enough. afterwards, you can improve on it.

and lastly, i'll sound like a broken record; but find the reason why you write. personally, i found mine to be evolving as time passed by. the essence of writing for me has always been to reach out to people with my works. and i believe i've already achieved that with the community that stuck with me even though i disappeared for two years sksk. i honestly just want someone to discuss my plots and characters with,, and i'm lucky to have those people, really. just being content with the same five reviewers geeking out with me every time i post a new chapter. so now that i've achieved the "reaching out" part, i'm currently just focusing on improving my syntax, sentence structures, and plot analysis. that's why i don't think i'll go back to soc med fics. it's just not for me, and if i spend time going over those for traction, my reason for narrative improvement will be lost. i'm just chilling tbvh i haven't written in a while. but at least i know that at the end of the day, regardless if i update after weeks, that the same people would still talk to me about my fic and that's enough motivation for me.

tldr; just chill, take a break outside of writing, and find your reason

good luck, anon~ hope you get motivated to write soon :)

August 24, 2022 11:11 AM
🌷 2661. Anonymous asked:
Do you think my story idea was cool? I don't really have confident to post it since I'm scared that what if people would not like it.
Author's reply: yeah, of course :) that's what's nice about fanfiction, right? you get to write about something you like at your own terms.

my advice though, is to know your reason as to why you wanna write. "why am i writing in the first place? to who am i writing this for?" and everything else would be easier after that. (e.g, writing for your own enjoyment, practicing writing, getting in touch with the writing community, passing time because you're bored, etc.)

just write, just practice. do your thing and be authentic to your reason so you could go back to it in moments of doubt. the audience who would resonate with your works will eventually find you, don't worry about others who won't! writing fanfiction shouldn't be an obligation.

rooting for you, anon~ take your time and take care :)
August 24, 2022 10:10 AM
🌷 2660. Anonymous asked:
How about Yoshiho Ate? It's a one-shot that can contain 3.5K words and up. It all started in high school. Yoshi really hates people who've taken what's his. Mashiho is a highly honorable but selfish student who thinks only about himself. Him and Mash were always fighting every time they met. To stop their annoyance, their classmates started shipping them, including Jihoon. Little did he know that Mashiho liked him(referring to Jihoon). Mashiho tried to stop him from shipping him with Yoshi because he liked him, but Jihoon didn't take Mashiho's word seriously. The shipping continues in a month. Both boys try not to fall for that goddam shipping, but later on they realize that they both like each other. They slowly interact with each other until Christmas comes. Yoshi decides to confess his love to him. Mashiho loves him too, but he's still not ready for a relationship. After graduation, Mashho leaves the Philippines and decides to live in America for good. Mashiho still didn't want to go back to the Philippines even though his happiness was there, until he received a call from his cousin about their grandmother's death. Mashiho was heartbroken and came back to the Philippines. While walking alone on the street trying to take some time off from his grandmother's death, he saw a newly built coffee shop nearby. Mashiho decided to enter the shop. After Mashiho ordered his, he scrolled through his phone. He heard his name called by, so he stood up and grabbed his coffee. When he was about to leave the shop, some stranger bumped into him slightly. It took him a minute to realize it was Yoshi. After an unexpected meeting up, Yoshi invites him to have some talk since it's been a year since they saw each other. Yoshi confessed that he still loved him and how hard he tried to find him in a couple of months, not knowing that he was going to America. Mashiho seems to be pleased to see someone who truly and genuiely loves him, but he didn't accept his love for a second time. He had a reason, but he didn't tell Yoshi. He understood him and will always understand him. Meanwhile, Mashiho runs into his old friend Jihoon in an exhibit, and while he still has feelings for him, he decides to let them go. Mashiho really liked him before. He tried to contact him back then in America, but it was all too late. Mashiho don't have feelings with him anymore. He truly loves Yoshi, but he is just afraid of what people will think about them if they get together. Mashiho already thinks of the consequences that can happen if they both get into a relationship. He loves Yoshi so much, but his love is not that strong to fight for him.

🌷 2655. ashxstry asked:
Hi miss! it’s muse ;) i just read sukhoon constellation and i feel like dropping my rants here hehe

ooof longing has to be one of my all time fav type of angst ;A; as someone who overthink before making any decision, it’s hard to choose something or someone just because i like them,,, which is kinda weird because what else do you need?? but choosing is just hard, yknow? we’ll be afraid of rejection, what other people think, is it possible? etcetc sksksk so i really love it when they finally able to choose each other after the long process of longing

it feels good as in the good feeling after solving a difficult math problem

‘ how can something so beautiful and clear be farther than the stars themselves?’

‘ Longing now turned into a stanza of a poem he can finally verbalise.’

‘ They can't go back to normal because normalcy

didn't entail intimacy.’
Author's reply: please same longing and yearning is one of my favorite tropes ever you could just write so much heartbreak in paragraphs and it's just an internal monologue lmfao >< ALSO SAME LOL i take into consideration EVERYTHING before liking someone and i always end up just liking them platonically because it works best that way. personally, i feel like rejection is something a lot of people are afraid of, but it really depends on the current dynamics you have with the person if they'll take it well, be chill about it, or be down right awkward. and thus, the overthinking occurs.

hehehe love those lines <3 thank you for dropping by, muse!!

"And maybe, just maybe, a part of him didn’t want people closer than drawn lines—not because they’d disappoint him, but how he’d disappoint them."

May 29, 2021 10:52 AM
🌷 2604. Anonymous asked:
um hi? i just wanna say that i'm glad i saw one of ur aus and i was inspired to write a book. and yes,,, i wrote a book ㅠㅠ but the thing is, i want to interact with my readers but i have social anxiety, what should i do? :((
Author's reply: yoo u gotta stay in touch with me,,, like this is beyond fanfic levels this is an actual bOOK so u have no choice but to stay in touch with me in my other account, k??? /lh

talk to me about it :) if you want!

i'm not as well versed in social anxiety compared to generalized anxiety (which i have). but first, i think it's better to explain to them briefly (if you're comfortable) about your situation. you'd be surprised that most, if not all, of the people who interact with you would understand and be more mindful about it. i think it's easier to moderate interactions and expectations that way too.

if this is perhaps being overwhelmed when you get replies and messages, and you want to respond to each of them but you don't know how; what i do is, i don't force myself to reply, and just do when i'm in a proper mindset to interact,,, which is,,, not often lmao. you don't have to prolong the interaction tbh, if that's what you worry about too. taking a step, breaking the ice, aka replying with brief responses at first would most likely help you be more comfortable in interacting with them in the future.

tldr;

- don't force yourself to reply

- you won't get used to it unless you start, but be mindful of your comfort too; so baby steps

good luck with your writing journey :) i'd love to keep in touch with u and the ur book updates

🌷 2600. Anonymous asked:
