Author's reply: hello~

honestly, no. if you've read my closing note, my comfort comes first before the numbers i receive here, so it was easy for me to let go of this account. sure, i have a lot of works here that are very dear to me, a lot of readers too. but starting fresh is honestly the best decision i've made.

the readers who read for my writing still have the choice of staying in touch through my other account. i think that's what's most important for me, starting off again with a community built from that.

i guess my advice is, don't think about the numbers too much. think of the reason why you really want to create another account first, and go from there.

you can still reach out to me here if you have any questions, or if i closed this i'll create a new cc in deusxluna.

good luck! :) and take care too

May 01, 2021 02:10 PM
🌷 2579. Anonymous asked:
hi jhour I’m here again hsjsj I’ve been worrying about smtg lately so I just wanted to vent it out. I told you that I’ve been wanting to write as well. Well I made some progress last week and I started writing. However, what if nobody reads my works? This has been on my mind a lot. Like what if nobody even finds it, reads it let alone likes it?
Author's reply: hello~ welcome back!

how to be discovered:

i guess if you're starting out, try to reach out to other writers and readers within the community :) my first tweet was actually me just trying to find mutuals who are interested in reading english works for treasure (you could still search for it haha), or you could use the #teufind tag and i'm sure readers/writers would find you. and lastly, don't forget to tag your works accordingly (ship, tags, au, fic, drabble, treasure etc.), i assure you a lot of people search through those, because a lot of my readers find me through it.

hate/criticism:

if nobody likes it fuck them. im just kidding. on a serious note, if nobody likes it (which i doubt, since i've only ever encountered nice readers here, they will always outweigh the negativity), then maybe think back as to why,, if it's just general hate, ignore it. if it's constructive criticism, take it into consideration.

remember the main reason why you started writing in the first place. if you're writing for yourself and you want to improve on this skill, then it's definitely okay to write with a few audience in the beginning (people will find you through the tags, trust me even new au accs i see have like 25 immediate followers). at the end of the day, readers who would resonate with you and your works will stay with you :)

good luck~ drop by if you wanna ask more questions
May 01, 2021 02:07 PM
🌷 2578. Anonymous asked:
hi jhour!

A few weeks back, I told you you’ve encouraged me to start writing too (tho I feel like so many people tell you this haha) so I just wanted to update you on that.

I came up with a prompt after thinking so much. And what I realized was that writing isn’t as easy as it seems. I’ve always been complimented on my English writings (I’m not a native English speaker) in school which encourages me a lot, but when I read works of people like you, I realize I still have a long way to go. And I don’t hate it bcos it makes me wanna improve even more. To reach a certain level of excellence.

When I started writing after coming up with the prompt/plot, trust me when I tell you, I couldn’t write at all. I don’t know why but I just couldn’t. Everything seemed so difficult even connecting sentences was even harder than school essays hsjs.

It just made me appreciate you even more. The time and effort you put in your work is really visible and your works are always gorgeous and so well worded. You really have a way with your words that just makes me feel so many emotions.

I hope I can become as talented as you some day.

I love you and your works jhour! Have a great day/night and a good rest pls!
Author's reply: hi anon~

oh, i get you though. it's really hard to structure sentences especially if you want your readers to feel a certain way. i sometimes look at blank pages of documents for minutes and hours too, and i assure you even authors who are known publicly experience writing slumps that take years, novels getting published one to two years apart.

writing is hard, there's no going about it. it takes a lot of reading and learning before you can write as effectively as you would like to. and even then, you won't be satisfied because you'd only want to strive to be better, to reach that certain prose structure professional writers possess; believe it or not, i still feel this too. but just know that even wanting to improve on this skill is something you should already be proud of :) you see, i haven't read your works yet, but just having read your cc and knowing people around you praise you for your writing, you're already doing great as you are. just remember not to be too hard on yourself and do things at your own pace :)

really proud of you~ drop by any time if you wanna talk to me about your thoughts and progress! I love you too and I hope you have a great May ahead!

🌷 2572. Anonymous asked:
Hi, Jhour!

I've recently just came across your work, and I'm so glad I did. Like you, I've always been passionate about writing, but I stopped a few years back because of other matters (aka responsibilities) at home and in school.

Then, I was once again reminded why I got interested in writing in the first place when I had my literature classes during the beginning of the year--I was able to express myself. Whenever I have a hard time, I usually just bottle everything up and let time do its thing. Time, after all, makes everything better, but it does not heal. Suppressing emotions doesn't mean that you've successfully mananged them, it only engulfs you with perpetual loneliness and emptiness.

Through writing, I was able to confront them. Aside from that, you're also one of the many factors that sparked that flame that has once been extinguished in me. I'm really grateful for that.

One time I was reading your work while I was at an emotional and very anxious state, I was really tearing up. I don't even know if it was because of the emotions that greatly overwhelmed me that time, or your beautifully crafted words (could be both lol). I've always felt a sense of warmth in your writings, so I want to thank and commend you.

I hope you that you'll keep doing the things that you love and that make you happy. I'm so proud of you! All the best muwah luv u!
Author's reply: hi~ welcome to the community :)

i don't know if you know this, but we had the same reason for putting writing on hold. i didn't write for five years until i tried to find a sense of purpose again during very dark times.

that's so nice knowing you had an avenue to go over your passion for writing. i never had any writing/literature classes back in uni since i was an engineering major. i hope i took some, but i didn't, in fear that i wasn't as good as i was before and i have to confront that fact with my grades haha.

i do agree that writing helps us free ourselves from the emotions suffocating us. i've been doing it for years, but not exactly in a form of stories i write just like now. i'm saying this to you in hopes that you could write for yourself too, maybe journal or a personal private blog to vent your emotions. these alternative platforms helped me before i decided to write my healing in story format. although i personally believe you already are doing that :)

i'm very happy to know that my stories helped ignite your interest in the art of writing again. please know that i'm very proud of you for giving your passion another try and i actually want to thank you for even giving my works a shot.

you're doing really well, i know you are. just acknowledging you're healing and the fact that you're aware how suppression wouldn't help is already a step in freeing yourself of your fears and anxieties. take your time and breathe, and know that i'm rooting for you :)

luv u too~ thank you so much for dropping by!

🌷 2568. Anonymous asked:
hello jhour! just wanna let you know that you inspired me to write again🥺 deep down, writing has always been my passion, but because of the pressure of people’s expectations, i eventually stopped for ~4 years. i kind of associated my writing skills with my self-value. it has become my only source of validation (?) throughout those 4 years, i also gone through a lot of painful experiences that furthered my self-loathing. but somewhat, your au’s made me realize that i should write for myself—that writing in itself can be instrumental as i go through my process of growth. i am still learning how to love myself, so thank you very much for your works which have been really helpful for me. i don’t even read fanfics before, but i’m grateful i came across your “of suffering and other vices” on my tl. i have rediscovered my love for writing and will soon be making a writing acc of my own as a passion project where i can freely dump my creative juices without striving to always be “perfect” (also where i could transform my traumatic experiences into stories)💖✌🏻
Author's reply: hi anon~ sorry for the very late reply :( i hope you'll still see this!

i'm so glad you've picked up the pen again to write for yourself! it's never too late to go back to what made us happy in our past, because our passions will always welcome us back with open arms. and it's very nice to know that you've reflected on how your worth isn't measured by what you produce, but more on what makes you happy, doing things you love just by the mere fact of enjoying them.

writing is such a curious thing, isn't it? it can serve as an outlet for ourselves but letting other people learn as we learn from it too. in which case you found me in my process of healing, and i know through this, other people would find you too should you post your works in public. it's a beautiful concept, a ripple effect that changes perspective.

i'm so happy my fic happened to stumble upon your timeline. i just want to thank you as well for giving my works a shot :) just remember that we can strive to be good, even strive to be the best, but we should always be kind to ourselves regardless of the outcome. enjoy the process, anon. perhaps you can tag me or drop by here again if you want to share your works with me :) all the best xx
April 25, 2021 02:54 PM
🌷 2567. Anonymous asked:
Part 4 of Venus

Aquarius: Junghwan

For Junghwan, he wants to be seen as someone who is free-spirited, visionary, and intellectual. “I’m a unique guy who will show you an unconventional path”. He’s giving people freedom to do what they want to do, especially if it involves exploring new ideas. Although he’s quite liberal, he still wants some structure in his life. Sometimes he can appear as an aloof, standoffish, and flippant. He also struggles with facing confrontations, avoiding it like a plague. He’s also scared of displaying intense emotion out. He only trusts a few selected people, but he’ll ride or die with them. He likes to be with someone who can be his bestfriend, his companion in chasing his dreams, and someone who won’t restrict him. He might like art and stuff from the past and also stuff that are futuristic.

Pisces: Jihoon

Venus is exalted in Pisces. Although it’s not ruled by Venus like Taurus and Libra, it’s still going to thrive here (‘00L all have good Venus placements). Jihoon is a creative, intuitive, and dreamy guy. He wears his heart on his sleeve, compassionate, and capable of showing great empathy. He has a motto of “I love you just the way you are, and I just want you to be happy”. His love is an unconditional love, and he’s willing to make sacrifices for the ones he loved. He doesn’t care about superficial things, what matters to him is what a person is inside. He might appear too sensitive, and that’s because he feels emotion deeply. He’ll be attracted to gentle souls who need protection. One thing he needs to be careful of is projecting his imagination to people. Even though he can read people, he might be struggling to see people for what they really are, because he wants to see the good in people. If the image of a person and their bond in his head shattered, he might become resentful. Overall, Jihoon is a loving guy who gives love generously to people. He’ll be their support system, and asking little to none in return. He’ll be thriving in humanitarian activities, and he’s also good in creative activities like singing and dancing.

Whew, that’s a long ass explanation. I hope your brain won’t be fried reading all that 😅 Anyway, Yoshi showed his Mars in Gemini on the recent Tmap, grumbling over little grievances 😂. I was curious about Jaehyuk’s lucky strikes, and he has Mercury conjunct Sirius. I don’t know much about stars, but Sirius is a star with great power, so.... watch out for anything that comes out of Jaehyuk’s mouth. His words might hold some power in it.

🌷 2566. Anonymous asked:
Part 3 of Venus

Libra: Junkyu

Venus is also the ruler of Libra, like Taurus. For Junkyu, everything needs to be in balance and harmony for a relationship to work. “I’m a nice guy that will make sure everything is in harmony”. He’s kind, diplomatic, gentle, and willing to make relationship work. Whenever conflict arises, he’ll try to seek the middle ground. He has his own vision of love, and this is the area where he struggles. Oftentimes, relationships became his main focus more than himself and this can results in him neglecting himself. He wants to see beauty in everything, to the point that he might projects the fantasy he has in his mind. He might stay in a dying relationship for a long time, holding on to the hope that it’ll turn into the fairytale he has in his mind. Might gloss over the deeper issues in relationship, and very unhappy in an imbalance relationship. He’s attracted to someone that is gentle, elegant, and gives them words of affirmation. When he’s in love, he wants to spoil you and share things with you. As a Venusian, he has good artistic sense. He’s thriving in creative fields, like music and making arts.

Capricorn: Doyoung

Venus in Capricorn person is responsible, practical, and sensible. Doyoung is a hustler, with the mindset of “I show my affection by making things easier for you”. He shows love through helping you with practical matters, giving you gifts, and helps you plan ahead your finances. Because he wants to be a responsible and sensible person, he struggles in showing vulnerability. This problem could come from a rough childhood, when he kind of forced himself to be much more mature and responsible than people around his age. He dislikes having to rely on somebody, and likes to keep it cool when it comes to relationship. He can be warped up in trying to live up to people’s expectation, which can prevents him to enjoy the moment. In love, he’ll be attracted to someone that appreciates the things he has done, reliable, and faithful. He has good artistic sense, and loves high quality objects.

🌷 2565. Anonymous asked:
Part 2 of Venus

Cancer: Asahi

Asahi’s Venus in Cancer might make him look stoic, but he’s actually.. a hopeless romantic. He’s nurturing, helpful, and always ready to give his shoulder to cry on, but struggles in showing vulnerability, keeping things bottled up inside. “I want love, but I’m afraid to wear my heart on my sleeve”. He’s very selective of who he keeps company because he can read people. He struggles with putting trust and relying others, and demands very little from people. But when he feels comfortable with someone , he’ll pour his hearts out and the other party might be shocked to find out the depth of emotion he has. He’s attracted to someone who is gentle, attentive, and able to interpret his needs. Loves cuddles and being taken care of. He could be a little bit possessive. He’ll spend a lot of money for his family or his home, as Cancer is a sign that has ties with home. His aesthetic is homey and romantic. Some people said that Venus in Cancer, along with Gemini and Leo, are good at making money.

Leo: Jeongwoo

Venus in Leo person, like Jeongwoo, is warm hearted and kind. He has this mindset of “I want to make you feel good, and I’ll go through great lengths for you”. Love is the most important thing for him, and he’s very generous. He’s a loving person, but struggles with his perception of worth, especially if he’s invested in something he loves. Oftentimes, he needs to seek validation from others to reaffirm his worth. He might also be struggling in seeing things clearly about things or someone he’s emotionally invested in. If he seems to be acting frivolous, it’s because he’s trying to put a front in order to protect himself from feeling hurt and keep things to himself. When he’s in love, he’ll serenade you, give you gifts, and brings you to a romantic dinner. He’s attracted to someone who can give him lots of affection, pamper him, and genuinely appreciates him.

🌷 2564. Anonymous asked:
This is the first part of Venus series. I guess you can grasp the concept of rising sign now. Let’s move on to Venus. Venus is a planet of art, things you value (money, relationship, other material things), things you take pleasure in, and beauty. This is just a brief intro, now I’ll talk a bit about Treasure’s Venus sign.

Aries: Mashiho

Venus in Aries person prefers to show love in action rather than words, so Mashi will show his love through action. He has this “I want you and I will win you over” mentality. He’s ready to give all of him when he feels that the person is worth fighting for. Although he’s passionate in love chasing, he’s not a courteous person, and this could make him be in conflict with others. Love matters are usually being approached delicately, but he approaches it with cut and dry method. He might be struggling to balance out between being diplomatic and holding control. He’ll be attracted to a person who’s fun to be around, direct, and passionate. He might be an impulsive buyer. Likes bold arts.

Taurus: Yoshi

Venus is domicile in Taurus, a sign that constantly seeks sensory pleasure. Yoshi would spend money on things like food, any art he’s taken interest on, and luxury things to satisfy himself. In love, he needs security and dependability. “I’m a dependable guy, and going on a date with me means having a fine-dining in a cozy place”. Love needs to be expressed in a physical and steady way. Might become a possesive lover. Attracted to a person who is loyal, sensual, and able to be his companion when he wants to indulge in any sensory pleasure things. He might be struggling with giving too much but expecting too little. Take break-ups and losses a lot harder than anyone.

Gemini: Hyunsuk, Jaehyuk, Yedam, Haruto

Venus in Gemini people are versatile. They have wide range of interest and sets of skills. They’ll try to win people over with witty conversations, displaying their intelligence. People often regard them as flirty. “I fall in love with the mind first”. They love variety, stimulations, philosophical and intellectual diacussions. They’ll take you out of your comfort zone, explore things with you, and help you awaken something that is hidden inside you. They’re attracted to a witty, funny, and interesting person who keeps them guessing. They might be struggling with having emotional attachment, prefer to keep things light-hearted to protect themselves. They might shy away from people who showed them grand gestures. They’ll show love and create arts through love letters, poems, and song lyrics.

🌷 2560. Anonymous asked:
Jihoonhour, Zodiac Anon here! This time, I’m going to explain a bit of information about rising sign & venus. It’s very long and needs to be breaken down, so bear with me.

Rising sign is a sign that is above the sky at the time you’re born. Basically, it sets the tone in your life, and also your appearance and vibe. It also determine the 12 houses and planetary position.

Let me use an example based on your chart. IIRC your rising sign is Libra. That means your chart ruler is Venus (Venus rules Taurus & Libra), and your Venus is located in Virgo (12th house). Venusian are usually good-looking and gives off elegant vibe. Since your Venus is in Virgo, you might have a small and slender frame. Since your ruler is in Virgo, you might resonate more with Virgo traits rather than your Leo traits. With Venus in Virgo, you’re someone that is able to create a compelling story with so much details, as Virgo placements are great writers. You have vivid imagination, and have a talent for world-building. You’re a very talented writer, but you have a tendency to bury down your works because you’re afraid of people seeing a part of yourself that is reflected in the fantasy stories that you wrote (because it’s in 12th house, it’s very hidden, yet your life revolves around matters in this house). You’re very comfortable building images in the unknown world, but you seldom let those close to you to see your work because you’re trying to protect the fantasy, the world that you built with your heart and soul.

🌷 2520. Anonymous asked:
Jhour, Zodiac Anon here.

Finally you replied 🥺 No need to feel sorry for taking a long time, I know you’re exhausted and drained. I hope taking a time to rest for yourself will rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul.

Regarding the Junkyu drabble, I’ve also come to realization that some things are clearly not working for me anymore, and that’s fine. Nothing in life is static , the only thing that’s constant is changes itself. The drabble kind of giving different answers to different people. For some, it could be a suggestion to take a break and rediscover oneself, for others it could be a validation of what they’re feeling, for another group people it might be a sign to pivot.

I think that’s the beauty of creative writing, to be able to give people a perspective, make them interpret and reflect on the piece, and find the message that resonates with them. I’m glad to be able to find your writing acc in the middle of a time where the world needs healing.

About creative writing, I’ve written one but it’s still sitting in my draft because I just started a business in the beginning of April 😅 I’ll visit the draft soon.

🌷 2476. Anonymous asked:

Author's reply: don't forget to put trigger warnings and research carefully on the topics. be as accurate as possible in portraying them but it's okay if you're not that knowledgeable in them, just put it in the author's note. warnings would also be better before the actual update or in the caption. good luck! and you're welcome~

But my guess it's from misunderstanding that piled up bit by bit because of their polar opposite characters. 🤔 Kyu looked like someone that prioritize his goals first above everything, and on top of that he's someone that show affection toward his loved ones in a very subtle way almost unnoticed. On the other side Ji looked like someone who give everything he has for his loved one, became their pillar constantly but refuse to let others knowing that he need them too. It felt like Ji the one who left Kyu before, however they're hurt as much as the other. 💔 I hope they will have a proper talk and stop doing the push & pull moves.

2. HJW spideyboy - If Dobby knew Woo is going to the crime scene, I bet he would be ready to make a scene with the KoreaGovt for sure. 🤣

3. Haruhwan Tie You To Me - OH.MY.GOD.J.

I always love AU with soulmate genre, the red string one, the color rush one, the tattoo one, but Tie You To Me is like how I should put it in words? Softly and sweetly mesmerizing! You really write it beautifully like you always do with your other works. Haruhwan AUs would be your fluffiest works I read hahaha (not complaining tho). Their love is so innocent I really want to treasure it when reading it. 🧡

4. Sukhoon Sigil on My Skin - HAHAHHAHA that's okay, but better you make a very long update to compensate that. hahha jk J. 😆

5. Other recent Fluff Drabbles:

I am a bit surprised when you posted some drabbles which most of them are fluff hahaha but I really enjoy all of them. I've reviewed the junkyu centric & sukhoon in my previous cc.

a. HJW Time & Space

I'm glad you made the sequel of it. I've got teary eyes & a bit heartbroken reading the first one.

 “My mom said sometimes people retain the memories of their past, when their soulmate hurt them in their previous life," this idea of soulmate is both beautiful & hurt at the same time.

b. Jikyu Act Natural

Jikyu is the cutest here, like everyone except themselves know how love dovey they are as "bestfriends" even mashi said they're practically married for years hahahaha... 😆 This Jikyu love is the heartwarming one and make you feel younger (although I'm not that old 😂)

c. Yoshikyu Drawing Heartbeats

This one is really sweet and funny. I feel the secondhand embarassment when kyu said "I'm crying because I can't understand" what a lame excuse HAHAHHA sorry kyu. 🤣

You can call me A or Ayane, whichever to your liking and convinience. And also from now, I will put lil signature of mine in the end of my rambles to you, to make it easier for you to recognize me. 😂

I read in your other acc about you're considering to take indefinite hiatus. I will support & respect whatever your final choice is, J.

- A☀️🦊

🌷 2456. Anonymous asked:
Hi ji, I become your fan very recently, I really enjoyed all of your writings. I've been meaning to reach you through dm, but you're current in a closed doors as of the moment. I'm in my early 20s, 3rd year college to be exact. But idk, i just felt so lost these days, pressures are weighing me down. 'til know, I'm still not discovered my passion and my purpose, i cannot figure it out. can you give me a piece of advice?
Author's reply: hii, sorry for the late response. you could also reach me through privatter (if you want to reveal yourself through a personal message system) but i actually respond slower there too >< haha

well, i don't really think i'm the best person to ask this because i'm way past uni and i'm still lost hahahaha,,, but ok i'll try to be as coherent as possible with this advice;

don't force yourself too much at the given moment. i'm not saying don't try to find what your passion truly is, but try to tread through everything carefully. it's hard to make choices when we think of our future in the line, but if we force ourselves there's a high possibility we end up being more lost.

reflect on yourself first before taking action. maybe think of the things and activities that make you happiest, and go from there. the process of finding it may be short or long, it really depends, but one thing's for sure; it's definitely okay to take your time.

just remember you don't have to live in other people's social clock. do everything at your own pace since you're still young and there would always be room to find yourself.

April 09, 2021 05:39 PM
🌷 2447. Anonymous asked:
I wonder why you write fanfic au... cause im pretty sure you can build a very well written character like hana, any specific reason you choose fan fiction?
Author's reply: i actually have original works but they're more on the fantasy/scifi genre (i barely have romance, mundane writings in my folders before i started writing fanfiction). i used to publish them on a website [fictionpress] years ago but since ao3 has become more mainstream while i was away in the writing community, it's hard to find an audience for specific original works.

if you follow my author's notes, you'll know that a huge part of my motivation comes from talking about my stories with someone because it stimulates my brain to come up with more ideas. with this, having an audience became a vital part for me to push myself to post updates and write.. and here comes kpop head smashing its way to my life along with discovering the writing community it has. i mean, it's a win win to be honest, writing about something you love.

of course if you think about it, all my characters are just,,, characters. so it doesn't matter if hana's well written, because in my opinion, jihoon, junkyu, and all my other characters in my other works regardless if they're original or they take up a name of an idol, are complex too since i'm an author who focuses on characterization. they all have different background stories and personalities that makes them, /them/. you just have to dissociate themselves from the people they are based on and think of these characters as someone entirely different.

you could technically just change all their names with one click in the document and call it an original work sksk

i don't really think it matters much if i write fanfiction or original works. because at the end of the day, what matters is the message i try to put across them and how it's perceived by my readers.

writing is an art that takes different forms :)
April 09, 2021 05:26 PM
🌷 2446. Anonymous asked:
hi jhour hahaha!!! it's 12am here in my region but i just got time to give the whole essay i promised you few days ago. mind you that it's gonna be so long, it'd be a lot of typos also, might as well some sentences r grammatically wrong lol lol. but i'm just really scared if it's gonna be too late, so here you go.

🌷 2445. Anonymous asked:
the fact that I was in junkyu's place last year, I didn't know what I was doing, what I'm supposed to do here, everything was what's, why's, and what ifs. even thinking was so hard for me, I want to share my problems to others but I'm afraid that I will hurt people bcoz my words can really hurt someone that's why I kept it in my mind. everything was so perfect before but then this sudden wave of sadness yet it doesn't feel like that, I didn't actually feel anything I'm just blank, blank like my heart. I didn't care about everything, it's so hard trying to make myself feel like me again. Author's reply: tw // mental health

hi anon, it's been almost a month since you sent this and i sincerely apologize for answering just now as i've been having personal conflicts as well :(

i don't know if you'll even see this, and you didn't exactly specify if you wanted advice or you just wanted to vent, so i'm just going to label the advice with a bracket below if you feel that you need it, but you don't have to if it could potentially trigger you.

i want you to know i'm extending my comfort to wherever you are, and know that i'm proud of you for even reflecting on your negative emotions. i've been there, it's really difficult especially when you can't even point out what makes you feel sad anymore. but know it already makes you brave just by confronting it. you don't have to have it figured out entirely right now, and that's fine. my ccs could be your safe space as you try to navigate them.

if you want to actively do something about it you can proceed below;

-----------------------------------------------

[advice]

although i advocate for mental health, i'd just like to reiterate that in no way am i a practicing professional in the field of psychology. i'm merely basing this on my experience and the experience of the people around me.

if that's recurring in your life for almost a year then perhaps it's [best] to seek professional help [if you can and the resources are accessible]. i believe there are online consultations right now especially when mental health problems are high during the pandemic. reading through your cc gives me a feeling that this is already interfering with your day to day activities, and i always say this to everyone who has sent me similar messages; although what we're going through is very different, and we hurt in different ways, somebody much more knowledgeable than us may actually help us understand what these feelings entail.

in the case that mental health services aren't accessible, i feel that it's best to reach out to someone you really trust, if you can and you're comfortable with this idea. i know you said you felt like you could potentially hurt someone with these thoughts, but if they love you they would understand. easily said than done i know. you don't really have to force yourself and do this, but just know that these could always be options when you feel like everything's becoming too much.

-----------------------------------------------

sending you all the comfort and love, even though im just a stranger from the internet.

breathe and remember that at the end of the day you could go back here again :)

April 06, 2021 06:00 PM
🌷 2441. Anonymous asked:
Hi jhour~ I actually have a concern, so I have been writing a few aus. But nowadays whenever I want to continue my ongoing aus, I get so overwhelmed and ended up closing the tab off. Do you have any advice or tips that I can work on?
Author's reply: hello did i just ghost write this for myself? haha on a serious note, what i've been doing these days is to take a lot of rest, and go through other hobbies that make me feel calm (meditation, gardening, journaling, etc.) or if it works for you too, maybe try to write one shots so you can write and close the document the same day if you have the urge to write something.

i understand how overwhelming ongoing works can be. planning the next chapters, the progression etc. but just remember to take things slow so you won't be anxious trying to continue it. you can look up the chunking method as well, basically it's grouping smaller tasks (in our case as writers, smaller scenes into chapters). you'll find that once you push past the initial resistance to write that one single scene, you'll find it easier writing scene after scene.

don't force yourself to write :) open the document when your mind is clearer and more calm to produce work you'll be satisfied with.

hope this helps and just reach out if you wanna ask about anything else. all the best!

🌷 2439. Anonymous asked:
Hi miss jhour! I finished the junkyu drabble, it was very well written! The message and emotions definitely came across, i felt it. I think a lot of us had gone through similar situation, so i just thought I'll share mine hehe

For me, the worst experience was the last year of my high school. Nothing bad happened - that time was honestly the peak of my high school career. Yknow, good grades, winning competitions, leading programmes, known by people. But I guess those were what pushed me to become... heavy. Alive, successful, but not quite content with it. And it's just like what you described; the painful feeling of not being able to feel anything. Numb.

Unlike Junkyu though, I didn't have anyone who could help me out sksksk well even I didn't notice as I slowly pushed people away and building up a wall. Until one day, I went out with my sister to try out new things (kinda like a hobby) and at the end of the day she pointed out : "I thought you didn't enjoy what we did today because your eyes seemed lifeless."

I couldn't sleep that night lmao it was bothering me that I should feel happy, but couldn't feel it. I dug inside myself, what actually was bothering me?

It was loneliness. And to tell the truth it always loneliness that bothers me every step i take.

The better my grade, the higher I get, more and more admiration turned to me. As well as jealousy, because they're kinda inseparable. And really, I couldn't care less about what others think about me, except if it's someone close.

It's just that the people closest to me at that time thought the same. That I was exceptional, on another level, that I was different. It made me lonely to think that they couldn't understand me, because who else could if not the one I put trust in? I felt... disconnected. Because the one they saw was the image of myself that I built, one I expected them to see through because they were with me behind the scene.

Once I realize and acknowledge that feeling, I took the step to tell people how I feel and those conflicts that happened in my head. Uh, they probably never understood how much that discovery meant for me, but it was my breakthrough. The moment that I realize the heavy, numb feeling in my chest can go away, albeit slow, but it can go.

I still do feel the same loneliness from time to time. Maybe someday I'll find my soulmate that'd understand sksksksk it's not that serious though

That was long and a bit dark im sorry hshsh maybe i should write this longer and turn it into a whole story plot 😭 i can make this shorter but idk i just want to make it dramatic lmao if you really read this thank you 😂
Author's reply: hi! :) sorry for the late reply :( i hope you still see this though.

your cc. oh my lord. it feels like my fifteen year old self ghost wrote that. i know you're not asking for advice, so i'll just tell a little bit of my own story too, in case you can pick up something from it.

just like you i was an overachieving high schooler, student council, was part of the top etc, however that's when my depression started to form. i'm not exactly sure back then how it suddenly took place; the pressure to please, the pressure to stay on top, perhaps. but i was doing fine with it, high functioning, albeit pretty badly when i'm alone.

so when i started to open up to my closest friends about it, my feelings, loneliness, my beliefs; it felt like a slap on the face when not one of them understood, which only made me wary of all the relationships and friendships that came to my life from that point on.

fast forward to now, past college, waay past high school, having the same set of close childhood friends but a different level of maturity, i now understand that perhaps these types of emotions were experienced by us way earlier than our peers. i tried to understand why i couldn't get the kind of support system i needed when i was younger, and realized that maybe our friends didn't know how to respond to emotions they're not familiar with.

because as we grew up, with a different set of problems, being more mature, going past different relationships, them realizing what loneliness truly meant, it's easier for me to talk to them about it. although not entirely, still.

sometimes i still find it hard opening up my thoughts to certain people, that's why i turned to writing. i understood that perhaps our loved ones never truly meant to dismiss our feelings, they're just not the right people, maybe for now, or maybe not at all. we need to understand that just because we love someone, doesn't mean they're on the same wavelength as us. and that's definitely okay. we still love them, and they still love us.

we just need to find the right people to talk to about certain things. and i hope you find the kind of support system you deserve, anon. in the mean time, during your search for your soulmate, you can reach out to me should your thoughts drown you during the day :)

if you decide to write it as a story, send it to me if you're comfortable enough to share it hehe :) see you around, and i hope happiness will find you again.

🌷 2415. Anonymous asked:
Here's my lil theory for the jikyu au!

Is it jihoon's fault or junkyu's fault? Or someone else?

1. Jihoon : a thing that caught me is hyunsuk's conversation with junkyu at the restaurant, which he said jihoon love to take care of something - someone. But then he's still confused with jihoon, and junkyu gave up understanding long ago. I think there's a sentence about ji need to realize some flower wont fully bloom(?) Maybe ji need to realize just because he take care of somehing not necessarily will turn out like he want it to be

2. Junkyu : i think he's very focused on his self growth and career. When they first met, he mentioned that boy can wait, his future can't. He also prioritize work before family day, and said baby and business should be kept separate. But he still do care about people around him, he just express it less. Also, he mentioned he cant focus on more than one thing, which is why (i assume) he stop performing and cant pursue education and love at the same time.

Maybe, they couldn't understand each other. Maybe jihoon spend a lot of time trying to make it work but junkyu focused more on his own growth, so it create a misunderstanding that junkyu doesnt care. Maybe at some point ji took care of other people and junkyu got jealous because he seem to do that often. They both seem to still like each other, so i think the reason behind their fallout must be some kind of misunderstanding or clash in opinion, because your writing indicate that jihoon cant understand junkyu, and junkyu cant understand jihoon. They admired each other but cant grasp what's in each other's mind.

And here comes hanhan! I think when ji's able to pour his care on the baby, his need to take care of something can be satisfied and not depend on junkyu anymore, letting him see the situation clearer that junkyu actually care but has other things he wanted to do. Junkyu, on the other hand, would learn how to manage his time and priority because he cant choose between work and hanhan, he just going to make it work somehow.

This might be far fetched lmao anyway i enjoyed the story so far and excited for more 🤩 thank you for the great stowy
Author's reply: okay since i can't really respond much for theories, im just gonna post your cc for others to find it :)

one thing's for sure, you were really paying attention and understood the characters really well (also picked up a lot of details i put in there).

thank you so much for dropping by, it was really nice going over your theory because you gave me details on how you came up with them ;) jikyu really do need a lot of talking to clear things between them. we'll see if you're correct in the next updates hehe

ps, icb you said it's far fetched sksk your theory's really really great (:

March 14, 2021 06:12 AM
🌷 2404. Anonymous asked:
Hi jhour! I read your carrd and saw that you've been in a writing rut for 5 years. You don't have to answer if it's too personal but I just want to ask why and how you got out of it? You're making me want to go back to writing again and I don't know if I will yet but I wanted you to know you're the biggest factor in pulling me back. Take your time with the updates because we'll wait for it! Stay safe and much love ♡
Author's reply: oh, my earlier readers know this but i don't actually have proper writing experience. i did write for fun before (years prior), just like now, however i had more free time back then. uni happened which sucked the living shit out of me, mental health problems, etc.

i focused on getting my engineering degree and afterwards my work (do u see the timeline now haha). let's just say quarantine hasn't been the most helpful at keeping certain thoughts in check, and it finally gave me some time to do something else. i wasn't the happiest and i've had a lot of thoughts going back to things that used to make me happy; which mainly includes writing.

technically it wasn't a "writing rut", per se, but more of, i didn't have enough time before and now it's presented to me. basically i just needed that initial push to post my works out there, regardless if i wasn't following proper syntax, practices etc. i just write for fun and knowing people resonate with my works is enough for me to write again :)

i guess just take your time. have a healthy relationship with hobbies you like, don't think you're forcing yourself to write for the sake of producing something. write for yourself and for the people that resonate with you and your works, and you'll get the right push to write another day :)

see you around! <3
March 14, 2021 05:56 AM
🌷 2403. Anonymous asked:
hello!! im not sure if anyone asked this before, but i’m curious about your au writing process. since you write the updates as they come, do you just go with the flow or do you already have a plot line in mind? thank you for answering, looking forward to all your updates!!!
Author's reply: i only plot the outline before updating. i already have outlines for multiple chapters, sometimes until the epilogue.

example of chapter outline:

[hogwarts au]

prologue - introduce ji and suk, jihoon's personality, explain ji's annoyance, potions scene where jihoon fucks up

yeah that's basically what i have before i write everything the day itself sksk. dialogues, setting, word flow, and other things are just written on the spot. when i post the next update for quite some time (~10 mins) it means im still writing lmaooo

even for the one tweet fics, most of them already have full plots in my head when i post them, just not full blown verbalized yet :) thanks for the interesting question! and see you around~

Author's reply: hello~ idk if you saw my tweet earlier but you actually made me cry with this cc >:(

you're spiritual too <3 i've only been delving into spirituality recently and i've always been seeing angel numbers, including 888 :) one prediction for me this month is i'll attract like minded people and i'm guessing maybe you're one of them :D glad you told me about this btw~ it's always so nice seeing people who seek spiritual guidance.

thank you so much :( to be honest, i never meant to make healing look easy in my writing or how i portray myself in general. healing is a process, just as how i write them in my characters. i still cry to myself at random due to recent life events. it's okay to let ourselves understand that our feelings are valid, let us dwell and embrace them, understand that they don't make us weak. in my case, i try to express this into my writing and i'm glad i'm helping a lot of you heal through my works as i heal from them too :)

lmaoooo okay that was the most coherent crush confession/explanation in my ccs so i'm going to let it slide,, falling in love with how someone's mind works--i understand haha. i'm glad you fell in love with reading again :) it's such a wonderful hobby to have, and not to mention makes our mind work through the world's stagnancy right now.

🌷 2338. Anonymous asked:
I was wondering whether you've ever faced a situation where you're writing two or more works simultaneously and had to write the same pairing with very different dynamics? Does that kind of situation cause you any trouble?
Author's reply: yeah, i had to writeee uhmm sukhoon drabble (childhood friends) and hogwarts au (rivals),,, hmm haven't really stumbled upon problems with that since i think of all of them as separate characters with different backgrounds and personalities :) when you write a fic, separate the person they're based on from the characters, as sometimes we tend to think of their actual real life dynamics when we write them. also separate yourself from your other stories so as to not overlap them. it would be easier from there.

🌷 2301. Anonymous asked:
jhour help i'm planning to make an au account but i'm scared what if i don't have readers or people won't find my acc. can you give me some of your experiences on how you started?
Author's reply: hello anon~

i don't know if you're one of the latest ccs, but i'll still reply okay? :) sorry for replying just now btw :(

i actually started off asking for mutuals who wanted to read some english aus cos i cant seem to find them in teume stan twt. the next day i just said fuck it, and dropped To All the Boys regardless of the traction it got. because everybody starts out somewhere, right?

lo and behold, my initial mutuals loved it and started to rec it to their mutuals and those people recced it and the process continued, until i was able to finish my first au :) i guess, starting out, i was always so grateful of those initial people who's been with me from my first au. (HEA MF I LOVE YOU SO MUCH. thank you for bringing the simps gc together mwa u deserve the world my sugarplum. weap and simps my ogs you know who you are. im so proud a lot of you delved into content creating too. yall deserve the world ily) without them, i wouldn't have the traction i have now.

but let me tell you something, it's okay if you don't have much traction in the beginning. just remember that you want to write because you want to write for yourself. the people who would resonate with your works will follow. i guess it's good that you try to find a likeminded community too because they help so much for someone who is just starting out :)

just wanted to let you know im proud of you for having the courage to put your works out there <3 fighting, anon!
February 25, 2021 02:57 PM
🌷 2300. Anonymous asked:
hello! I wanted to start writing aus, but I was wondering how you get inspiration and ideas for prompts or for what to write?
Author's reply: welp, i actually think of prompts randomly from years of reading a lot im sorry huhu >< but for the plot, start with the prompt and plan out how the story would go from there :) (conflicts, setting, characters, etc.)

good luck! <3 im really proud of you for taking a step into content creating!

🌷 2236. Anonymous asked:
hi jhour!! im really sorry for this lame question but how do fics differ from drabbles? thank you i’m sorry for the question again t___t
Author's reply: noo it's okay,, i get why it would be confusing. in my context, fics refer to [all] my works. however i categorize them into three:

Long AUs - usually has 200+ or more updates

Drabbles - short stories; can vary from one privatter post up to less than 100 tweet updates

One Tweet Fics - self explanatory. but can be picked up depending on demand

i hope that cleared it up :) i use "fics" and "works" interchangeably sometimes
February 15, 2021 04:41 AM
🌷 2235. Anonymous asked:
Hahaha yeah although I'm your new reader I've spent my long weekend reading your AUs. :D I've just finished Bad Boys x Good Boys too. Your wordplay is really something. Like the emotion you put in every story feels real and raw. If you dont mind, maybe you've been asked this question million times, what is your inspiration to write? BTW Happy valentine J! Hope today you're full of love.
Author's reply: awwh thank you so much~ ;A; i don't think i actually answered this thoroughly before but most of my inspiration comes from my thoughts especially when i learn something new through my experiences.

a lot of my characters are based off of people important to me (junkyu from modern royalty was based off of my ex who learned and researched how to deal with my anxiety attacks, gon from bbgb is based from my closest friend in uni who acted like an older brother etc,) a lot of lines written in my works are said to me in verbatim too, (e.g, "solace doesn't have to take the form of vices"-mashikyu drabble, "i proved to myself that i could love someone unconditionally without getting anything in return"-to all the boys). i guess being surrounded by people with such profound, beautiful souls makes me want to write these lessons and experiences and share them so others can take something from them as well :)

my inspiration for the plots are rather different, that comes from my creative side. but characterization are things i picked up through observation as i grew up :) that's why they feel so raw and human, because they're based from real people who's been hurt, made mistakes, grew, and learned from them.

Happy valentines, anon!! :) hope you're enjoying yours too

Author's reply: right now, i'm still leaning towards discontinuing it
February 14, 2021 08:10 AM
🌷 2231. Anonymous asked:
I really love your writing comprehension and story line. May I get some tips?
Author's reply: welp, i just want to put it out there that i never took any writing courses back in uni and highschool as i leaned more towards science and engineering,, so please take these tips with a grain of salt and just know it's from a perspective of a writer who writes for leisure.

story line: first step for me is to always plan the plot. what's the setting? who are the characters? what's the main conflict and how will they resolve it? what will happen for each chapter? make your characters relatable, or if they're not, let them have complex characterization. flaws make them human, it makes your readers connect to them more.

and for the writing style, just do you :) personally, my flow is just my train of thoughts. i write what i'd feel the characters would say. if they're a teenager, write how a teenager would speak. keep it simple. you don't have to use big or complex words just to make it seem deeper than it really is. sometimes it makes the writing tacky and the flow out of place. experiment with similes and metaphors, play with your words, even a combination of simple words can make beautiful sentences :D

i hope that helped~ just drop by my ccs again if you have any more questions.
February 14, 2021 08:05 AM

February 11, 2021 12:25 PM
🌷 2210. Anonymous asked:
How are you managing your time with all the completed and ongoing stories you've written and personal life even to extent to your work life? I mean for me it will takes a lot of time to write those stories given the structure and plot are great. I hope you're genuinely happy :)
Author's reply: i was supposed to answer this earlier saying, "you make time for the things you love," but i realized it doesn't always work that way and most of the time it boils down to energy levels.

my 9 to 5 is pretty much set on my schedule, so the remaining hours after my work, i have a choice whether i could take some rest&interact [or] write an update. i can't do all of them in a day. my body just refuses to sksks

which is why i dont update as much these weeks because im not mentally and emotionally at my best. ive been in and out of hiatus for around three months, because as much as i want to, i [need] to talk to people right now. back when i still posted consistently everyday, i only got to interact with my readers during the weekends because id always fall asleep right after updating. im trying to balance that these days too because i want to show how grateful i am of you guys.

yes, writing takes a lot of time. it takes me around 1-2 hours to write an update when im in the zone and it extends to four hours when i get distracted by other things. sometimes i even write updates on the spot sksks so when i do update my day is just work-write-post-sleep.

i was happy because i liked making content and i get to inspire other people through my works. n that was good enough for me :) it's not a balanced thing to do,, i know that now.

i just want to let u guys know that it's ok to take breaks. just because you're not doing it doesn't mean you don't love that hobby any less (whether it be supporting your kpop groups, reading, gaming etc.)

take your time and do things at your own pace. i promise you that going back to it in a better mental state is worth it :)

🌷 2123. Anonymous asked:
Jhr, thank you for the new jikyu fluff prompt. To be honest, the message on the tags made me cry.

I just want to share something. I've lost a brother a few years back due to illness. It was hard on everyone. Even when we had already expecting it for a few weeks before since the doctor already told us.

The pain never went away completely. There are days when I went to sleep and woke up with my mind full of 'what if's and 'if only's. But out of the pain of remembering, I put forward more positive mindset forward. So whenever I had the question of 'what if', I turn it to reality with the people around me.

"What if we knew earlier and can actually cure him?" - I'll ask my family about their health today

"If only I told him more of how much I love and appreciate him" - I'll tell my family and friends that I love and appreciate them today.

I'll never forget him. He will always be in my prayers and thoughts. But now, I'll take care of those around me more.

I was a selfish person before, only thought of myself. But since he passed away, my family had gotten so much closer. I promised to myself, to be the best daughter, sister and friend. So I'll have no more regret.

Sorry.. I just want to share this. Sorry if I made you uncomfortable. Just want you to know, there is nothing wrong with remembering. Cry if you want. Remember the good times you had. And appreciate your family and friends more. Then the pain will be lessen by the beauty of love around you.
Author's reply: Hi anon :)

reading your cc made me think if i actually ghost wrote this. of course, our circumstances are different but there were a lot of similarities; the illness, the grief, the expectations and what ifs.

my heart goes out to you and your family and i just want to say i'm so proud of you for being so strong. i can't imagine losing someone so close to me, yet here i am. and there you are, strong despite the things life brought unto you. i couldn't help but cry reading your cc earlier, because i resonated with you a lot, especially the part where you try to put on a positive mindset so you could focus on those who need you right now.

thank you so much for dropping by and telling me your story, especially sharing how to turn thoughts into lighter more positive ones because i really needed it. you don't have to apologize :) it's okay, and i actually really appreciate your cc so i want to thank you for it.

the message on the au tag is actually for my goddaughter, whom i serve as primary godmother :) standing in as her second mom should events like this happen. the thought of raising her with her mother's memories is something that keeps me going right now, and i guess through her my bestfriend's legacy could be passed on.

she's such a ball of sunshine and i love her so much. i still cry when i think of the future but i know she'll look after me, her family, and her daughter.

thank you so much again for dropping by and thank you for reminding me that healing and love will always be there waiting patiently :)

🌷 2115. Anonymous asked:
hey i’ve been following you for a long time and would just like to say that i’m really sorry about your loss.. i can’t imagine what it must feel like to go through this, and even more unfathomable is the sheer strength of your spirit to reflect such love and light despite all that you are going through. i was worried when you deactivated and am glad you are back; i hope you always remember to take care of yourself. 💫
Author's reply: hi! thank you so much for the kind words :)

the past few days i saw that people deal with grief differently. not everyone cries, at least not in front of others. and i found that writing and reflecting what i feel personally helped me a lot. what might work for me might not work for a lot of people, and it's fine. It's fine because at the end of the day you still get to keep their memories with you :) especially happy ones.

it's hard, yes. the pain doesn't go away immediately, i don't think it ever will. but accepting is part of healing :D

thank you again and please take care too :)

🌷 2060. Anonymous asked:

Late Prince Sanghoon x Mrs. Choi = Hyunsuk

King Sungho x Queen Nari = the kims

sanghoon and sungho are siblings, born of the late king. the king (junkyu and hyunsuk's grandfather) and sanghoon, his first child, were assassinated sixteen years prior to the original timeline, making sanghoon the king in hyunsuk's stead until he comes of age.

hyunsuk always knew he was betrothed to jihoon because king sungho already informed him of it when his father passed, that's why he has a baby photo of him in his wallet. the kim siblings didn't pay much attention to the name of the kid, only knowing him as "our cousin's betrothed".

however, there was a second assassination attempt which i didn't discuss thoroughly. this was around the time hyunsuk was in middle school. it specifically targeted him, the king to be, which prompted him and his mother to flee the palace. much like jihoon, for them politics was already enough and they just needed to live peacefully without threats. his previously family name, kim, now changed to his mother's which is choi. that's why they refer to him as, "their favorite choi"

him and his mother went back to Seoul, not telling anyone it was only just for a while, so he could meet his supposed fiancé, as junkyu is already of age. he just wanted to get to know jihoon, that's it.

not fall in love with him all over again.

🌷 2046. wydysl asked:
so.... you know why i'm here :)
Author's reply: context: she's asking why jensoo stepped down

i didn't tackle this in my au because i scrapped out the political part, but in my story, just like modern times in many asian countries, their society is still patriarchal. that's why the targeted assassinations are still the men in line for the throne. the princesses are talked into stepping down for their "safety" but it's bad play at "it's not a women's world". they personally stepped down because they don't want anything to do with it anymore, being happier outside the politics that oppress them.

but in another life, in another au, i would have them fight the patriarchy, let Yuri hold the reins in the council and have Jisoo be queen with Jennie as her confidant.

🌷 2040. Anonymous asked:
very high quality aus!!!!! when are you gonna write a novel? I'd love to read it
Author's reply: hi~ i think i've answered this before but i'll answer more elaborately here :)

for now, i don't plan on publishing any of my works professionally (i don't even know if i ever will). i don't feel like they're worth publishing as of the moment, and i feel that i need to hone my craft in writing if i ever do want to do it in the future.

my current works are not beta read, and i know i make a lot of errors in grammar and other things. my flow isn't the best and im trying to improve it still. all in all, if i want to pursue a writing career i wanna follow the proper path of investing in my knowledge in the art of writing first because i want to produce work of high quality. my readers the deserve the best after all :)

tldr; i mostly just write for fun right now and i dont think theyre worth publising, but i wanna thank you for supporting me if i do plan to publish them in the future :) at least i already have one reader with me hehe

🌷 2014. Anonymous asked:
Hello jhour, zodiac anon here. I’m going to answer your questions, I hope you won’t be confused by my long explanations haha 😂

Yes, Leo is a fixed sign so you can identify some of the fixed sign traits in you. Regarding MBTI and astrology, it’s important to look at different perspective when you’re interpreting a person’s character, because nobody is one-dimensional. Each person has their own way of processing informations and emotions.

About compatibility, it’s actually more complicated because you have to consider their synastry and all. But if you look from the sign elements, you can see the patterns of Treasure’s dynamic. Water (Jihoon) meshes well with Earth (Hyunsuk, Junkyu, Yoshi). Fire (Mashi, Jaehyuk, Asahi, Doyoung, Haruto) get along with Air (Jeongwoo, Junghwan). Then we have Yedam, a Taurus (Earth) with Gemini stellium (Air), but since his Air placements are more prominent, he is closer to the Fire Signs and the Air Signs in the group.

Sun and Moon are important, but two people could have the same sun and moon and act differently, for example, JaeSahi. JaeSahi have the same Sun (Leo) and Moon (Virgo). They even have the same Mars (Sagittarius) and the same MBTI (INFP). They have different Mercury placement (Jae in Cancer, Sahi in Virgo) and Venus (Jae in Gemini, Sahi in Cancer) and these placements are what makes them different in communicating and showing affections.

Jae’s Mercury in Cancer makes him a great communicator and listener. He always make others comfortable, memorizing pieces of their informations well, and sensitive to nuances of communication, but could be subjective to a fault. Asahi has Mercury in Virgo, and this makes him someone who is resourceful, reliable, and detail-oriented, but not really good at lateral thinking. Jae’s Venus in Gemini shows affection through simulations and conversations, which is why he always does skinship and communicating. He also enjoys variety and he does this by hanging out with different people. Sahi’s Venus in Cancer shows that he’s actually an affectionate guy who secretly loves sentimental gestures and cuddles. He shows love in form of protection and taking care of other people, but since he wants security, he tends to hide his needs for affection until he feels safe.

Another thing to consider the Rising Sign to determine their house placements, but I don’t know their rising signs so I can’t go into further details. Lemme know if you can absorb this informations ☺️

🌷 2001. Anonymous asked:
Hi jhour, zodiac anon here. LMAO noo Suk isn’t lazy 😂. It’s just that fixed signs are usually slow to react, as they prefer to analyze situations first before giving responses and taking actions. Fixed signs also prefer to finish whatever things they started before moving on to the next. Stellium is when you have a cluster of three or more planets in one sign. For jihoon, his personal planets (sun, mercury, venus) are in pisces, it indicates that his life is heavily influenced by pisces traits

About MBTI, I think Jihoon’s mars in aries plays a big part in his ENTJ personality. ENTJ’s primary function is Extroverted Thinking, which is all about decision-making. Aries is a cardinal sign, they’re the initiator and also quick in taking actions, they also have leadership quality. That “ppali-ppali” habit of Jihoon? That’s an Aries trait, always rushing to quickly move on to new things. Imo, Jihoon uses his Pisces power to assess things, and then quickly makes decisions with driving force from Mars in Aries. He’s quick-witted and he’ll make decisions based on what he things is right and efficient at the moment. The manifestation of Extraverted Thinking may be a bit different from you, but essentially the thinking process is the same.

That’s an explanation from me. If you’re interested in other members’ chart, I’ll look at their charts too 😊 Oh btw, Yedam is the intuitive type too, since he has moon in pisces

https://twitter.com/noonarteume/status/1338122436600975363?s=19
Author's reply: theyre so cute please wtf jikyu twins >:(
December 18, 2020 01:14 PM
🌷 1975. Anonymous asked:
Hii im a new reader and i have read your jaesahi drabble and jikyu palace one and i just have to tell you i love your writing very much 🥺🥺 im learning to write stories now and yours really inspire me to do better... Like the plot is so clean and smoothly transitioned, the description feels real and the dialog wasnt awkward at all.. i read many fanfic but yours really satisfy my craving to read(?)

Do you have any tips to write better?

Thank you i love youu
Author's reply: Hi~ thank you so much :) i think i already answered something like this before but i'll just write what my remaining braincells can;

hmm i guess aside from the plot and scene descriptions, focus on the characterization of your characters. make them relatable. make your readers hate them, but let them understand where they're coming from. flaws make them human and they let your readers connect with them. if you want a redemption arc, that would be great too. if not, that's fine. remember to treat your characters like their human and like real life, some people don't really experience character growth.

for the dialogues, imagine them talking to each other. you don't have to write proper syntax, it makes it weird especially if theyre not meant to be that way. if your character is a teenager, write how a teenager would talk. make your readers differentiate their personalities through their dialogues.

i hope that helped for building up your characters :) send me a cc again if you wanna ask about plots.

most importantly, don't just write for the sake of writing or for the sake of producing something. write for yourself and for your readers. quality over quantity :) write when you know you're in the right mindset to do so.

i just wanna say that ure a really good writer i love all of your stories!!
Author's reply: thank you so much :(

December 14, 2020 06:22 AM
🌷 1961. Anonymous asked:
Hello I don’t know if anyone ask this question but how did you get into treasure and what made you bias Jihoon? I’m just wondering and thank you for au and your story always good.
Author's reply: hi! i don't think i actually answered this in detail before but grab some popcorn cause im bout to tell you a story.

you see, i fell into the survival show blackhole back in 2018-19. i was already stanning blackpink, listened casually to all yg groups, was still hung up with pd48, and was familiar with silverboys so it wasn't really a surprise that i watched ygtb.

i vaguely remember trying to figure out which trainees appeared in the skz survival. pretty much my bias was doyoung at this point, but then jihoon came in and i realized that he appeared in the yg vs jyp skz episode; but he was in team b. i guess it made me focus on him more because like i said, i was tryin to find the silverboys babies (which were doyoung, yedam, and jihoon), and i saw how he led team b for that go go performance. most of the time an idol's talent catches my attention first, but this time jihoon caught my attention with his initiative and drive to debut in yg despite leaving the company for a while.

the deal breaker for me was probably watching him interact with all the other trainees in ygtb's extra videos(?). i saw how everyone got along with him pretty well, how he was chosen for challenges by the others, and overall a great person to be around with. call it egotistical but i saw myself in him; my friends would often describe me as someone who can be put in a room with anyone and just make the person comfortable. that's basically him too. our personalities are so much alike it's kinda scary lmao,,, the way he teases and goofs around with others but can turn strict when he needs to,, literally me lol.

so yeah, he's been my bias since ygtb. stanned him cos i saw myself in him and his talents are literally god tier. i mean he was known as a dance line member but now he's a prominent member of the vocal line and a leader? like damn kid, god really has his favorites, huh?

i know i look like i stan him for the lulz cos he's the funny member, but i really feel like he's a comfort idol for me. i love him i really do, i just dont show it that much in twitter because im not the type of person to simp for my bias,, hahaha. i literally feel like im watching my little brother grow up from a cute lil kid to an annoying teenager lmao

regardless if he's the babie jihoon i met in ygtb or leader jihoon who i wanna fite 24/7, he will always be park jihoon, that one idol i resonate with the most.

AS FOR TREASURE, who wouldn't stan those kids after watching treasure box?? i mean come on ;A; fucking talented. each and every one of them. you'd be stupid not to stan the fucking daylights out of them after watching that show. im not invalidating post-debut teumes btw, im just saying, how can you not stan them after watching ygtb? blasphemy if you ask me.

pretty sure you didn't need that much detail but i'll be using this cc as a link if others ask me why i stan treasure and jihoon in the future :) hahaha sorry for answering so long and thanks for asking this!

🌷 1940. Anonymous asked:
Jhour consider yourself lucky because I saw your zodiac anon tweet 🤪 Well in continuation of the moon sign, sukhoon’s cancer moon explains their parental role in treasure as the moon is “the mother”. they feel fulfilled when they can be useful to others, like taking care of other people’s physical and emotional needs.

Jihoon has heavy water placement, having pisces stellium (sun, mercury, venus) and cancer moon. This makes him very sensitive, because pisces is the most sensitive zodiac sign. It also makes him very intuitive, this explains why he’s good at mafia games. Pisces work like sponges, absorbing feelings and informations. The downside is that it can be confusing for him sometimes, whether what he felt is his own feelings or other people’s feelings. A pisces’s emotions are like waves of tsunami crashing in.

Junkyu has sun in virgo. Virgos are meticulous and perfectionist. They always make sure they’re doing their job perfectly. They have a good eye on details and analytical, hence Junkyu’s habit of thinking about scientific things at night. Sometimes the need to do things properly can make them not able to relax. Their self-esteem depends on how well they do their job.

Suk’s sun is in Taurus. Taurus are are grounded and hardworking, they also constantly seeks pleasure. They’re artistic and good at planning. But because Taurus is fixed sign, it’s hard to get them to rush and move.

Anyways, another interesting piece: sukhoon’s mars are positioned at their domicile (suk: scorpio, hoon: aries). Jihoon is more impulsive, impatient, and a man of action. Hyunsuk is more secretive and strategic. Because Scorpio has double-ruler (mars-pluto) sometimes it can make the person “hides their true nature”.

🌷 1753. Anonymous asked:
I came across this cc on twitter, and I couldn't agree more! This is the very reason why I like really enjoy reading your works. I also wanted to say this for the forst time I read your stories but I didn't know how to put it in words.

I don't like reading aus tbh. I hate reading make up stories about idols tbh. It somehow affect how I view the idols themsleves. So i avoided it as much as I could. That's why i was skeptical on reading one before. But Im really glad I gave your works a shot. It never dissapoints me. Every story of yours. I can enjoy your stories wholeheartedly without changing my perspective on the boys.

Not all au authors can do that that's why im really glad i found a great writter like you.

PS: Im not into qrt works or leaving a comment most of the time and feel so sorry about that 😢

Author's reply: hi~

aaa im really glad you like my writing style :( you got everything down to a t. when i write, i really want to separate the characters from the people they're based from and have their own stories to tell. basically the idols are just the visuals for the story but not exactly themselves (like fan casting).

hsjhs it's okay :) at least we got in touch through here! i wont be discouraged any time soon, not when i have you guys :) i don't think id ever reach the point of publishing my works in the future (i feel like im still lacking in many aspects as a writer) but thank you so much for that. i'll be sure to inform you when i do ;A; <3
November 23, 2020 09:53 AM
🌷 1752. Anonymous asked:
Hi!

I've been following your work since the beginning. Yes, ever since the time you created the account because you said you think there was not enough TREASURE fics available on the internet.

But I'm afraid I have been a silent reader.

Well, till now. Now that I have gathered all courage (?) to talk to you after downing just four bottles of soju.

So first of all, I'm sorry I am a silent reader, and I'm sorry for sending a drunk message to you.

But I want you to know that I really, really appreciate you. And I am inspired by you.

You see, I graduated with a degree in journalism 5 years ago. And I work in news now. But for the last 5 years, I have not been able to write. At least not in the way that I would be really proud of my work and myself. I have been justifying my lacking self thinking that what I write is what is needed by the general public, though, not necessarily by me.

Your updates have been something I look forward to at the end of a very busy and sometimes really frustrating day.

Each of your stories are beautifully written. And they teach a lot. I think I get a better understanding of some people around me now because of your works. Thank you for writing them.

It is also comforting to know that somewhere out there, there is you who got over a long period of slump and got back to writing. I also see that you are very well-received by your readers. You really deserve it.

But honestly, sometimes, I hate you, too. And it's not your fault at all. It just happens whenever I feel the immense pressure to make my teenaged self proud of what I have grown into. (I think I am 2-3 years older than you.) A lot of times, I really feel that I am performing way, way below expectations.

I don't really hate you. I just sometimes want to be like you. Though, I know that you, too, are struggling with your own life.

I hope you are well. Or at least you get better soon. I'm sorry I could not offer more consoling words. I don't think I could even begin to understand what you are going though.

I'm also sorry for rambling and for unloading so much on you. I hope my message won't hurt you. I really don't want to hurt you because I really like you. Even though I've only known you through what you have written, I really think you are a wonderful person.

I'll try to be more open about my admiration for you.

More importantly, I will pick up the pen again. And I will make myself proud. And hopefully, you too.

Till then, have a good day! I love you.
Author's reply: hello :) im really glad you reached out to me (even when you're drunk hehe,, u got high alcohol tolerance too!!)

i don't know if you know this, but i guess we're sort of in the same shoes. im practically just working for money and capitalism at this point. months ago, i just needed a sense of self because i didn't know what was the point of my 9 to 5 when i wasn't happy with what i was doing. but im glad you still see the purpose of yours. i have high respect for journalists (my friend is one), and the amount of people you help through your work is something ive always looked up to. so just by that, i just want to say im already proud of you even though we don't know each other.

one of the reasons why i wanted to write again is because i wanted an avenue to help and inspire others as i can't do that with my current work. well, i could actually, but like i said im slaving for money and capitalism right now. i guess in that sense i envy you because your work revolves around helping other people, and although you don't feel fulfilled i want to assure you that you've touched lives one way or another.

thank you so much for the kind words. it really means a lot for someone like you whose profession is of writing to give my works compliments :( the validation you gave me with that cc is something i'll hold close to me so i just want to say im really really grateful.

and hey, it's okay. i too don't think im that good of a writer, but the amount of support i get here just keeps me going. it's okay to feel that we've let our past selves down, but remember we got so much time in our hands to go after the things that make us happy. take it slow :) and just do baby steps.

im doing relatively well. thank you for that :) i hope you're doing great yourself.

i don't know how many times ive said thank you here but thank you again for reaching out. im certain you'll do great writing about things you're passionate about given that your cc was so well written even when drunk haha.

im already proud of you. i hope you make yourself proud as well. i love you too :) have a great day~ i'd want to read your works in the future if possible :) im sure they're amazing.

🌷 1741. Anonymous asked:

let's refrain from the practice of self diagnosing, but never forget to take care of yourself.

if it makes you feel better, i was afraid of getting diagnosed as well, but now i wished i should've done it sooner. i hope you feel better, op. take care and have a great week.
