🌷 1740. Anonymous asked:
Honestly,, I love when you give treasure character changes in your aus(idk if that makes sense) but Ig it’s nice seeing different things each au since many other writers make each member their stereotypical personality(not saying that’s a bad thing) It makes it a lot easier to relate with what’s happening in the story

skxjxksnj idk if any of that even made sense sorry

—☁️
Author's reply: ah true, it really depends on the writer's preference. however, like the other op said, i don't really like to revolve their whole personality around a stereotypical one they're known for :) but that's for another discussion.

and yes exactly, i really want to separate my characters with their irl counterparts that's why i try my best to give them their own characterization (not necessarily completely different compared from who they are, i still try to add bits and pieces of them), because i want it to be focused on the characters and the plot :)

it did make sense don't worry. but yeah, it all boils down to the writer's preference :D im sure there are lots of great works out there in different writing styles uwu

To be honest, your stories brought me back to reading aus again. I appreciate you so much jhour! Thank you for existing! Thank you for sharing these masterpieces. All the love ♡ Keep writing! I'll always be here supporting you and your stories!
Author's reply: thank you so much :( i really loved writing the mashikyu one too although it's very short (since it's a drabble). hehe, ive had a lot of experiences and stories to know how to write that certain narrative, that's why it was easy for me to put them into words :) im glad it inspired you.

i appreciate you too :( although it's never our fault (our feelings are valid), im glad you see that life is more than what we feel at the moment sometimes.

thank you again for supporting me :) my stories will always welcome you
November 22, 2020 08:06 AM
🌷 1735. Anonymous asked:
Hi, Jhour. I've been commenting your posts from time to time (though not that often), but only now I finally will give you my feedbacks for your writings. Well, to sum up, I love them all. Your write in a simple but beautiful way, making your stories to be enjoyable and can be read by a wide range of people. You focus on your characterization which makes the characters to feel complex and like real people. I love that you don't take a stereotypical trait from Treasure members and make it their whole personality, like some writers do. Keep up your good works, Jhour. Sorry I never gave a comment on the qrt before. There are ups and downs as a writer that I feel myself but I hope you will never get discouraged and quit writing. You have talented hands and mind. <3
Author's reply: thank you so much and im sorry i only got to reply now :( i really appreciated your feedback and i didnt want to disappoint you with my reply so ive been putting it off since yesterday shjsh

im so glad you appreciate the characterization of my characters because i put a lot of effort into writing them :( and i agree, i don't really like plots that revolve around their stereotypical personalities in real life like they can't have any other plot device aside from that. it waters them down into surface level characters and i dont really like that because you can do so much more into writing them.

thank you so much for this review again :) i hope you have a great week ahead

🌷 1259. Anonymous asked:
part 2:

- not @ swings, i.e., ex-mentor/judge, rejoining as a contestant sksjfhd let's see what happens (also mnet must be rly thankful because they get more content that'd suit their dramatic editing; you'll see what i mean if at all you end up watching the first episode i don't wanna spoil)

- wonstein: i personally really liked his performance. he has his own unique style and really adds colour to the line-up. hope he gets to make way through this competition. definitely one among my personal favourites.

also, it was really refreshing to see people attempting so many different rap styles! :0 consider mukuro's screaming rap and the likes 🥺

- sycho: his 1st round perf hasn't aired yet, but i got familiar with him through the show 'my major is hiphop'. it involved varsity rap teams/clubs battling in the name of their institution, something like that. in fact, two (?) of smtm's judges/mentors, paloalto and zion.t, along with winner's song mino (runner-up of smtm4) were some of the mentors in that show. i found him to be really impressive, not just his rap but also his presence. looking forward to see how he does!

- it'd also be nice if we get to see more of female rappers. in the history of the show,, it's EXTREMELY rare that a female gets through to the later rounds, to the point where many people are unaware that women can also participate in smtm and think that it's is a male-only competition TT female rappers are the ones who are usually targeted in the initial battle rounds as 'easier' targets, so it's harder for them to make way through the show (which is also why they're usually chucked to unpretty rapstar, which is somewhat like the female-only version of smtm)

- there are a couple of other contestants that caught my eye, but these were the ones i could suddenly think of once i started typing. i also have judging teams that i'm rooting for, but i'll tell you once i've made up my mind :D besides, we've only seen half of the acapella rap round, so there are probably a lot more that we're yet to see!

so, this turned out longer than expected i rly should stop now aaaaa thank you for entertaining my rant >:(( you're the best <333
Author's reply: this one too if anyone's interested in watching smtm i'll leave this here

🌷 762. Anonymous asked:
hello! just dropped by to say that i'm loving your au! your cliffhangers are the best istg 😭

on a side note, this theme really hits home for me. ji's family and mine were very much alike ig. being the only daughter in the family, i can relate to what it feels like when one's shielded by their family to that extent, although with good intentions. in my rebellious days, i remember doing things, staying out at night with friends, for example, mainly because i was told not to, and not so much because i actually wanted to. the feeling of guilt that followed used to eat me away though. but eventually, i grew up, and both my family and myself learnt a lot with time.

the way i see it, the characterization is on point! 🥺 i'm sooo looking forward to see how things progress!

i was wondering, just out of curiosity, how far into the au are we? are we more than halfway through?

also, how would you normally overcome writer's blocks? since you're someone who updates almost everyday, or once in two days at least, do you perhaps set daily goals for yourself when writing?

that's about it for now. have a good day!
Author's reply: oh wow, that really is just like Jihoon's narrative. im glad you and your family settled in time. kinda the same in my account too, but i guess our families learn along the way that we can't be children forever :)

1. i was wondering, just out of curiosity, how far into the au are we? are we more than halfway through?

--yes we are :) im trying to finish it before i hit my second month in my au acc (Oct 16)

2. also, how would you normally overcome writer's blocks?

--so far i havent ran into any yet so i can't say for certain, but i make sure to write the au and drabbles in intervals to refresh my mind (eg, au update tuesday, drabble wed, au thurs) or completely just take the day off of writing

3. since you're someone who updates almost everyday, or once in two days at least, do you perhaps set daily goals for yourself when writing?

--not exactly goals, but more of,,, my mind and body feel the need to keep up with my daily routine. i have a day job and i pretty much just write and socialize after work. also i have too many ideas that i just have to write them, so i guess that's why im always writing (aside from being sort of a workaholic).

tldr; i dont have a goal,,, my mind just tells me to write

thanks so much for the support and i hope you have a great day too! :) really great questions btw

🌷 540. Anonymous asked:
hiii i was wondering if you have any tips for someone who’s planning on writing an au for the first time. i have several drafts and plots in mind but i really don’t know where to start :(
Author's reply: outline the whole story first (how does it start? is there a conflict? how will it be resolved?) :) then try to find inspiration for the imagery, the setting, and the characters. for written works, word play plays an important role in keeping your readers engaged. try to use metaphors, play with the sentence structure etc.

good luck!! and i hope you find motivation in posting your stories soon :)
October 01, 2020 11:52 PM

🌷 506. Anonymous asked:
Thanks! Here are the questions. Just have fun there's no wrong answers! The one thing I will say is try to be detailed as it makes it more fun to read! Okay, have fun! Make the coach as cruel as you like! (The tennis player in the scenario is Genie Bouchard, feel free to look her up before you start)

1. Where would Matt tickle Genie?

2. How can Matt make sure that Genie can not escape while he's tickling her? If he pins Genie down, how would he do it? What position would he put her in? If he doesn't pin her, what else could he do to ensure she doesn't get away?

3. How would Genie show Matt she has given up? What would she say/do?

4. Do you think Genie would beg Matt to stop tickling her or would she be too proud to humiliate herself in such a way? If she begs, how would she beg? How would Matt react to Genie’s begging? If Genie refuses to beg, how would Matt react to this? (You can even write a bit of dialogue here between Matt and Genie if you want, entirely your choice)

5. What would Matt make Genie say/do/promise in order to stop the tickling? Do you think Genie would do as Matt asks or would she refuse? If she refuses, how would Matt react? If Genie does as Matt asks, would he stop tickling her or would he just keep tickling her?

6. How would Matt taunt Genie while he is tickling her? What would he say/do and how would he say/do it? What would Genie’s reaction to this taunting be? (Again, feel free to include dialogue if you so wish)

7. How would Genie feel to be at Matt’s mercy? How would Matt feel to have Genie at his mercy?

8. What would be Genie’s worst moment of her tickling experience? What would be Matt’s favorite moment of tickling Genie ? Try to make the two answers here different but if you can't then that's okay.

9. If another player walked in, would she help Genie get away or would she help Matt tickle her? If she helps Matt tickle Genie, what role would she play in this?

10. Genie’s mother walks in. If she walked in to see what was going on, and Matt pinned Genie down and invited the mother to come and tickle her, what would Genie’s mother do?

11. Would Matt strip Genie of any of her clothes while he is tickling her? If so, which clothes would he remove and why would he remove them?

12. Does Genie deserve her tickle torture for her behavior?
Author's reply: really sorry anon, i dont think my two braincells could come up with answers for this one hsjhs good luck with your homework though! :)
October 01, 2020 08:12 AM

I started school w a class full of people that I dont know and I dont have social anxiety but i feel really nervous, stressed, anxious and shy around people that idk. during breaks I always read ur aus and it really helps me to forget a bit about that terrible environment I'm in.

I dont have any friends there so I have lots of time to read it and even if I only have like 10 min to read it, it feels really good...

idk if it's making sense by now lol but yeah I always joke when talking to u and all but know that I'm really thankful for it :) ly
